Still he doth love me wherever I stray;
Back to His dear loving arms do I flee
When I remember that Jesus loves me.

Oh, if there's only one song I can sing,
When in His beauty I see the great King.
This shall my song in eternity be,
"Oh, what a wonder that Jesus loves me!"

Jesus loves me, and I know I love Him;
Love brought Him down my poor soul to redeem,
Yes, it was love made Him die on the tree
Oh, I am certain that Jesus loves me!

If one should ask of me, how can I tell?
Glory to Jesus, I know very well!
God's Holy Spirit with mine doth agree.
Constantly witnessing - Jesus loves me

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Jesus, we lift our souls so Thee,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Jesus, we lift our souls so Thee,
Thy Holy Spirit breathe;
And let these little infants be
Baptized into Thy death.

Thy faithful servants let them prove
Girded with truth divine,
Be sharers in Thy dying love,
And followers of Thine,

Lord, plant us all into Thy death,
That we Thy life may prove;
Partakes of Thy cross beneath,
And of Thy crown above.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Come holy ghost descend from high
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Come holy ghost descend from high
Baptizer of our spirits Thou
The sacramental seal apply
And witness with the water now.

Pour faith thy energy divine
And sprinkle the atoning blood,
May Father, Son and Spirit join
To seal this child, a child of God.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Stand, soldier of the cross,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Stand, soldier of the cross,
Thy high allegiance claim,
And vow to hold the world but loss
For Thy Redeemer's name.

Arise, and be baptized
And wash thy sins away;
The league with God be solemnized,
Thy faith avouch'd today.

In God's whole armour strong
Front hell's embattled pow'rs,
Apostles, seers, evangelists,
And martyr throngs enrolled

In God's whole armour strong
Front hell's embattled pow'rs,
The warfare may be sharp and long
The vict'ry must be ours.

Oh, bright the conqu'ror's crown,
The song of triumph sweet,
When faith casts every trophy down
At our great Captain's feet.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.
Therefore go and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name
of the Son and of the Holy Spirit. Matt. 28:19.

A lowly heart that seeks pardon
Thro' the precious blood of Christ,
Come and know the revelation
Of the smile that Jesus gave.

Hear the blessed Saviour calling
Listen to His divine voice,
di	Do not fear what 'ill may betide
When, His way, you have chosen.

Jesus Christ said, "Go and baptised
Those who believe in my name"
The Lord was also once baptised
In muddy River Jordan.

Let us follow His footsteps here;
Follow Him, do not tarry,
Receive His commandments with joy,
Behold, He has led the way.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: O Lord, would Thy pardon
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
O Lord, would Thy pardon
Such a sinner like me?
Has my sins been carried away
And has Thou made me glad?

Could it be that the Cross you bore
For me, despising shame?
Ought I then, Lord to be ashamed
Of thus being baptised?

Thou made Thyself an example
In waters of Jordan;
Why should my pride refuse to yield
To do what Thou has done?

Jesus, the zeal of love Thou shows
Blames my own cold response,
But my feet now is swift to walk
In the way of Thy will.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: We are baptised unto His death
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
We are baptised unto His death
By water baptism
And we go down into the grave
Buried with Jesus Christ.

Buried with Christ to sin no more
That we may rise with Him
That we may partake of new grace
That fist us for the skies.

O Holy Ghost, come unto us
That all our words may be
The hope of His soon appearing
And Christ's revelation.

Lord, let our faith be glorified,
Our joy and crown fulfil;
To live a life of heav'n earth,
On high, to reign with Thee.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Have we e'er heard those weighty words,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Have we e'er heard those weighty words,
That we are buried with the Lord
That body of sin be destroyed

Our hearts receive a new spirit
As it is raised up from the dead
So Christ also rose from the grave
And lives in heav'n above wi4h God.

Therefore, let not the devil reign
No more in your mortal body
All sins that have bound us before
They shall no more have dominion.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Almighty, God of heav'n and earth
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Almighty, God of heav'n and earth
Jesus the Son, that became flesh
Holy Spirit, for all our care
Hear us and receive all our vows.

We accept Thee, Thou who art slain
Thou who ascended up to heav'n
With Thee, we are dead unto sin
Our hearts would be raised up with Thee.

We want to believe Thy gospel
We go, and Thy hand leads us on;
At Jordan, we seek for the way
That Thy own disciples have trod.

By baptism - a great token
We surrender ourselves to Thee;
Put Thy seal on the covenant
And make us forever Thine own.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Hear the voice from heaven saying
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Hear the voice from heaven saying
To Jesus, in River Jordan
A witness is to all the world
"This is my own beloved Son".

Without sin He and perfect
But to fulfil all righteousness
Of baptism in the water
He made Himself an example.

Son of the Father's own bosom
Is Salvation for all mankind
The source of life for the sinner
Jordan, brought near to Calvary.

Come, thou, follow now thy Saviour
Obey the command, be baptised
Example of death with Jesus
And the resurrection with Him

Come, do not be curious to know
A secret which the Lord would keep
Put obedience first and at last
The result will them be revealed.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.4.7.
He that believeth and is baptised shall be saved but he
that believeth not shall be danned. Mk. 16:16.

See these ones in white apparel
Standing by the river's brink
Their backs turned to the world and sin
And waiting to be baptised
And expecting
To fulfil the Lord's Command.

Blood, now they stand there in fear
But they not of hope bereft
They know that their blessed Saviour
Commanded their immersion
Jordan is cold,
But their faith is waxing hot.

Behold and see, other brethren
Their elders in Jesus Christ
Stretch out hands of love to help them
They have been like them before
At this moment,
They rejoice in pard'ing grace.

Go, follow your Saviour and Lord
Behold with the eye of faith
The heavens open: God's spirit
Loudly saying from heaven
"These disciples,
Are my beloved children".

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 6.7.6.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.7.6.D.
Preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.Luk. 3:3

The voice that sound in the desert
It's the voice of watchman
Hark as the voice now calling
Calling for repentance
The voice as it was sounding
Art thou not now concern'd
And why, O brothers, sisters
Do you feel unconcern'd.

The kingdom is now at hand
The kingdom of our Lord
And those that wash their garments
Shall sit on royal throne
Why do you feel unconcern'd?
To the voice of watchman?
Which sound new to thee clearly
Seeking for repentance.

The Abner and Pharpar stream
They may be clean water
But the command of cleans
Is in river Jordan
Throw all thy thoughts to one side
And do the will of God
Now descend into this stream
And wash and be thou clean

What's now keeping you waiting?
What can be your excuse?
Behold the steam and Thy John
All things are now ready
`	You have argued for long time
Will you die with spirit?
Sinners hear the watchman's voice
And come to repentance.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.10.7.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.10.7.&.Ref.
And the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanseth us from all  sin. 1Joh. 1:7.

I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood
For He wash'd my sins away,
And I know there is joy in serving Him
For He turnedmy night to day.
There is power, power, wonder working power
There is power, power, purifying power,
There is pow'r in Jesus blood.

I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood
From my guilt He set me free,
When I came unto Him with all my sins
And His blood availed for me.

I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood,
For all things have been made new;
Since His own precious blood has been applied
And has cleansed me through and through.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: `	Jesus, thou Joy of loving hearts,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
`	Jesus, thou Joy of loving hearts,
Thou Fount of life, Thou Light of men
di	From the best bliss that earth imparts
We turn unfilled to Thee again.

We taste Thee, O Thou living Bread,
And long to feast upon Thee still,
We drink for Thee, the fountain-head,
And thirst our souls from Thee to fill.

Our restless spirits yearn for Thee,
Where'er our changeful lot is cast;
Glad when Thy gracious smile we see,
Blest when our faith can hold Thee fast.

O Jesus, ever with us stay,
make all our moments calm and bright,
Chase the dark night of sin away;
Shed o'er the world Thy holy light.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: According to thy gracious word,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
According to thy gracious word,
In meek humility,
This will I do, my dying Lord,
I will remember thee.

The body, broken for my sake,
My bread from heaven shall be,
Thy testmental cup I take,
And thus remember thee.

Gethsemane can I forget?
Or there thy conflict see,
Thine agony and blody sweat,
And not remember thee?

When to the croo I am mine eyes
And rest on Calvary,
O Lamb of God, my sacrifices,
I must remember thee.

Remember thee, and all thy pains,
And all thy love to me;
Yea, while a breath, a pulse remains,
Will I remember thee.

And when these failing lips grow dumb,
And mind and mem'ry flee,
When thou shalt in thy Kingdom come,
Jesus, remember me.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.6.6.
The bread that I will give is my flesh for the life of the world. John. 6:51.

I hunger and I thirst,
Jesus, my manna be;
Ye living waters, burst
Out of the rock for me.

Thou bruised and broken Bread,
My life-long wants supply;
As living souls are fed,
O feed me, or I die

Thou true life-giving Vine,
Let me Thy sweetness prove,
Renew my life with Thine,
Refresh my soul with love.

Rough paths my feet have trod,
Since first their course began,
Feed me, Thou Bread of God;
di	Help me, Thou Son of Man.

Thou still the desert lies
My thirsting soul before,
O living waters rise
Within me evermore.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 8.7.8.7.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.7.8.7.&.Ref.
And the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanseth us from all sin. 1 John. 1:7.

What can wash away my sin?
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
What can make me whole again?
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
Oh, precious is the flow
That makes me white as snow!
No other fount I know;
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!

For my cleansing this I see
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
For my pardon this my plea-
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!

Nothing can for sin atone-
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
Nought of good that I have done-
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!

This is all my hope and peace-
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
This is all my righteousness
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
10.
Give ear, O shepherd of Israel, thou who leadest Joseph like a flock. Ps. 80:1.

O King of mercy, from thy throne on high
Look down in love, and hear our humble cry

Thou tender Shepherd of the blood-bought cry
Thy feeble wand'ring flock in safety keep.

O gentle Saviour, by thy death we live;
To contrite sinner's life eternal give.

Thou art the Bread of heav'n on Thee we feed,
Be near to help our souls in time of need.

Thou art the mourner's Stay, the sinner's Friend.
Sweet Fount of joy and blessings without God.

O come and cheer us with Thy heav'nly grace,
Reveal the brightness of Thy glorious face.

In cooling cloud by day, in fire by night,
Be near our steps, and make our darkness light,

Go where we go, abide where we abide,
In life, in death, our Comfort, Strength and Guide

O lead us daily with Thine eye of love,
And bring us safety to our home above.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.7.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.D.
Lord, to whom shall we go. John. 6:68.

Lord, tow whom except to Thee
Shall our wand'ring spirits go;
Thee Whom it is light to see,
And Eternal Life to know?
Awful is that Life of Thine
Which the Spirit's Breath inspires,
And the food must be Divine
Which each new-born soul desires.

Israel on Heavenly seed
Fed and died in days of yore,
But the souls, that on Thee feed,
Never thirst nor hunger more,
Lord, to whom except to Thee
Shall we go when ills betide?
Who except Thyself can be
Hope and help and strength and guide?

Who can cleanse the soul from sin,
Hear the pray'r, and seal the vow?
Who can fill the void within,
Blessed Saviour, who but Thou?
Therefor evermore I'll give
Land and praise, my God, to Thee,
Evermore in Thee I live,
Evermore live Thou in me.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
10.10.10.
And I	I will love him, and will manifest myself to him. John. 14:21.

Here, O my Lord, I see Thee face to face;
Here would I touch and handle things unseen,
Here grasp with firmer hand the eternal grace,
And all my weariness upon the Thee lean.

Here would I feed upon the bread of God,
Here drink with Thee the royal wine of heav'n,
Here would I lay aside the each earthly load,
Here taste afresh the calm of sin forgiven.

Too soon we rise, the symbols disappear
The feast, though not the love, is passed and gone
The bread and wine remove, but Thou art there-
Nearer than ever-still my shield and sun.

di	Feast after feast thus comes and passes by;
Yet, passing, points to the glad feast above,
Giving sweet foretaste of the festal joy,
The Lamb's great bridal feast of bliss and love.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
10.
This is my body which is given for you.
This do in remembrance of me. Luk. 22:19.

Drawn nigh and take the Blood of the Lord,
And drink the holy Blood for you out-poured.

Saved by His Body, hallowed by His Blood,
With souls refreshed we render thanks to God.

Salvation's Giver, Christ, the only Son,
By His dear Cross and Blood the vict'ry won.

di	Offer'd was He for greatest and for least,
Himself the Victim and Himself the priest.

He, Ransomer from death, and Light from shade
Now gives His Holy grace His saints to aid.

Approach ye then with faithful hearts sincere,
And take the pledge of Salvation here.

He, that in this world rules His saint, and shields,
To all believers life eternal yields.

With Heav'nly Bread makes them that hunger whole,
Gives Living Waters to the thirsting soul.

O Judge of all, our only Saviour Thou,
In this Thy feast of love be with us now.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.D.
Ye do show the Lord's death till he come. 1 Cor. 11:26.

Till He come - Oh, let the words
Linger on the trembling chords,
Let the little while between
In their golden light be seen;
Let us thing how Heav'n and home
di	Lie beyond that Till he come".

When the weary ones we love
Enter on their rest above,
Seems the earth so poor and vast,
All our life-joy overcast?
di	Hush! be every murmur dumb.
It is only till He come.

Clouds and conflicts round us press;
Would we have one sorrow less?
All the sharpness of the Cross,
All that tells the world is loss,
Death, and darkness, and the tomb,
Only whisper "Till He come".

See, the Feast of Love is spread,
Drink the Wine, and Break the break
Sweet memorial - till the Lord
Call us round Hs heav'nly Broad,
Some from earth from glory some,
Served only, till He come.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Be known to us in breaking bread,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Be known to us in breaking bread,
But do not them depart,
Saviour, abide with s, and spread
Thy table in our heart.

There sup with us in love divine,
Thy body and thy blood,
That living bread, that heav'nly wine,
Be our immortal food.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.
Jesus said unto them , come and dine.Joh.21:12

Jesus, to Thy table led,
Now let every heart be fed
With the true and living Bread

While in penitence we kneel,
Thy sweet presence let us fed
All Thy wondrous love reveal.

While on Thy dear Cross we gaze,
Mourning o'er our sinful ways,
Turn our sadness into praise.

When we taste the mystic wine,
Of Thine outpoured blood the sign,
Fill our hearts with love divine.

From the bonds of sin release,
Cold and wav'ring faith increase,
Lamb of God, grant us Thy stand

Lead us by Thy pierced hand
Till around Thy throne we stand
In the bright and better land.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 9.11.9.&.Ref
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
9.11.9.&.Ref
He hath wash'd us from our sins in His blood.Rev.1:5

Have you been to Jesus for the cleansing power?
Are you wash'd in the blood of the Lamb?
Are you fully trusting in His grace this hour?
Are you wash'd in the blood of Lamb?
Are you wash'd in the blood
In the soul-cleansing blood of the Lamb?
Are your garments spotless? Are they white as snow?
Are you wash'd in the blood of the Lamb?

Are you walking daily by the Saviour's side?
Are you wash'd in the blood of the Lamb?
Do you rest each moment in the Crucified?
Are you wash'd in the blood of the Lamb/

When the Bridegroom cometh will your robes be white?
Pure and white in the blood of the Lamb?
Will your soul be ready for the mansions bright
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb?

Lay aside the garments that are stained with sin,
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb?
There's fountain flowing for the soul unclean-
Oh, be washed in the blood of the Lamb!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: There's one above all earth friends
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
There's one above all earth friends
Whose love all earth love transcends,
It is my Lord and Christ divine.
My Lord because, I know He's mine
I know He's Mine, this friend so dear,
He live with me He's ever near,
Ten thousand charms, around Him shine,
And best of all, I know He's mine.

He's mine because He died for me
He saved my soul, He set me free,
With joy I worship at His shine,
And, cry, "praise God, "I know He's mine.

He's mine because He's in my heart,
And never, never will we part,
Just as the branch is to the vine,
I'm joined to Christ, I know He's Mine

Some day upon the street of gold
Mine eyes His glory shall behold
Then white His arms around me twine,
I'll cry for joy, "I know He's mine"

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7
And to know the love of Christ, which passeth knowledge Eph 3:19

Jesus Thou kind hearted Lord
To Thy table now lead us
With the true and heav'nly bread.

While we kneel around Thee Lord
Thy sweet presence let us feel
All Thy wondrous love reveal.

While we gage on thee with faith
Weeping o'er our sinful ways
Turn our mourning into joy.

When we taste the mystic wine,
Of Thine out poured blood the sign,
Fill our hearts, Lord with Thy love.

Draw us to Thy wounded side,
Whence there flowed the healing tide;.
There all sins and sorrow hide.

From the bonds of sin release,
Cold and wavering faith increase,
Lamb of God, grant us Thy peace.

Lead us on with Thy pierced hand
Till we reach Thy throne above
In the bright and better land

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: The hour is come, the feast is nigh
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
The hour is come, the feast is nigh
I give Myself to you
Behold I give my blood to you
Shed for your redemption

Till my Father's kingdom above
Before I drink again
By then, no more shall tears be shed
It shall be joy for aye.

This supper shall e'er continue
Until His kingdom come
All o'er the world shall many souls
Eat this supper and drink.

God's blessing shall be pour'd from heav'n
Upon all those who eat
And from my Father's throne on high
I'll prepare them a place.

But now, for the present l'll drink
The bitter cup for you
And for your sakes, l'll drink the cup
Of sore anguish of death.

Ye cannot know my deep sorrow
Nor yet, my glory seen
But this, continue ye to do
And thus, remember me.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: The Holy Communion
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
The Holy Communion
The grace of God it is
To eat the bread and drink the wine
In remembrance of thee
In remembrance of that feast
We are ga-thered today
To show the lord's atoning death
Until He will come back again Until my
(Until my Father's kingdom on high)
Before I...
(Before l drink with you once again)
This is our type of Passover feast
Time of deliverance is
When, l by faith, cling to that shed blood
l shall freedom receive
Sickness and need shall flee,
Satan's army may rise
We shall conquer them all
Thro' the blood of the Lamb
Holy Lamb

The blood that flowed for sin
We see, in this, the type
It is a witness in our heart
That we shall really loves us.

This little type of feast,
If it is here so sweet
How sweeter still in heav'n above
When we shall see Th face.

Then we shall surely know
That we are your symbol
All Thy wonderful goodness ways
Proclaim for evermore.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 8.8.6.& Ref
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.6.& Ref
We have forsaken all matt.19:2

My life, my love, l give to Thee,
Thou Lamb of God, who died for me.
Oh, may l ever faithful be,
My Saviour and my God!
I'll ;live for Him who died for me,
How happy then my life shall be!
I'll live for Him who died for me,
My Saviour and my God!

I'll now believe thou dost receive.
For Thou hast died that l might live;
And now henceforth I'll trust in Thee,
My Saviour and my God!

O Thou who died on Calvary,
To save my soul and make me free
I'll consecrate my life to Thee,
My Saviour and my God!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Saviour of all, to thee we bow,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Saviour of all, to thee we bow,
And own Thee faithful to Thy word;
We hear Thy voice, and open now
Our heart to entertain our Lord.

Come in, Come in Thou heav'nly guest,
Delight in what Thyself hast give:
On Thy own gift and graces feast,
And make the contrite heart Thy heaven.

Smell the sweet odour of our pray'rs
Our sacrifice of praise approve,
And treasure up our gracious tears
And rest in Thy redeeming love.

Beneath Thy shadow let us sit,
Call us Thy friend, and love and bride!
And bid us freely drink and eat
Thy dainties, and be satisfied.

O let us on Thy fulness feed,
And eat Thy flesh, and drink Thy blood!
Jesus, Thy blood is drink indeed:
Jesus Thy flesh, is angles' food.

The heav'nly manna faith imparts,
Faith makes Thy fullness all our own;
We feed upon Thee in our hearts,
And find that heav'n and Thou are one.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
10.11.10
Let every one of in particular so love his wife even as himself. Eph.5:33

O perfect Love, all human thought transcending,
Lowly we kneel in pray'r before Thy throne,
That theirs may be the love which knows no ending
Whom Thou for evermore dost join in one

O perfect life, be Thou their full assurance,
Of tender charity and steadfast faith,
Of patient hope, and quiet brave endurance,
With childlike trust that fears nor pain death

Grant them the joy which brightens ear-thy sorrow
Grant them the peace which calms all earthly strife,
And to life's day the glorious unknown morrow
That draws upon eternal love and life.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.76
And God blessed them. Gen.1:28

The voice that breathed o'er Eden
That earliest wedding-day,
The primal marriage blessing,
It hath not passed away.

Still in the pure espousal
Of Christian man and maid
The Holy Three are with us,
The threefold grace is said.

For dower of blessed children,
For love and faith's sweet sake,
For high mysterious union
Which nought on earth may break.

Be present, heav'nly Father ,
To give away this bride,
As Eve Thou gav'st to Adam
Out of his own pierced side.

Be present, gracious Saviour's,
To join their loving hands,
As thou didst bind two natures
In Thine eternal bands

Be present, Holy Sprit,
To bless them as they kneel
As Thou for Christ the Bridegroom
The heav'nly spouse dost seal.

O spread Thy pure wings o'er them!
Let no ill pow'r find place,
When onward through life's journey
The hallow'd path they trace,

To cast their crowns before The
In perfect sacrifice,
Till to the home of gladness
With Christ's own bride they rise.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Rest in the Lord - from harps above
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Rest in the Lord - from harps above
The music seems to thrill
Rest in his everlasting love
Rest and be still.

Rest thou, who claimest for thine own
Thy chosen bride today,
Affianced in His faith alone
Thy bride for aye

And thou, whose trustful hand is given
Avouching here thy spouse,
Rest, for a Father seals in heaven
His children's vows.

Rest ye, who cluster round them both
Is standing by your side,
And in this union draws more near
His mystic bride.

Rest for the Heav'nly Bridegroom here
Is Standing by your side;
And in this union draws more near
Rest and be still.

Rest in the Lord - thrice Holy Dove,
In us Thy word fulfil -
Rest in His everlasting love,
Rest and be still.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 6.7.6.D
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.7.6.D
What therefore, God hath joined together let no man put asunder. Matt. 19:6

O Father, all- creating,
Whose wisdom and whose pow'r
First bound two live together
In Eden's primal hour,
Today to these Thy children
Thine earliest gift renew;-
A home by thee made blessed,
A love by Thy kept true.

O Saviour, Guest most bounteous
Of old in Galilee,
Vouchsafe to-day Thy presence
With these who wait on Thee;
Their store of earthly gladness
Transform to heav'nly wine,
And teach them, in the tasting,
To know the gift is Thine.

O Sprit of the Father,
Breathe on them from above
So searching in Thy pureness,
So tender in Thy love
That guarded by Thy presence,
From sin and strife kept free,
Their live may own Thy guidance
Their hears be ruled by Thee.

Except Thou build it, Father,
The house is built in vain;
Except Thou, Lord sustain it,
The joy will turn to pain:
But nought can break the union
Of hearts in thee made one,
And love which Thou hast hal-lowed,
Is endless ;love begun.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.6
So God created male and female and He blessed them. Gen 1.:27&28.

O God of love, to Thee we bow,
And pray for those before The now,
That closely knit in holy vow,
They may in The be one.

When day are filled with pure delight,
When path are ;lain and skies are bright
Walking by in faith and not by sight,
May they in Thee be one

When stormy winds fulfil Thy wall,
And all their good seems turned to ill,
Then, trusting Thee completely still
May they in Thee be one.

Whate'er in life shall be their share
Of quik'ning joy or burd'ning care,
In pow'r  to do and grace to bear,
May they in Thee be one.

Eternal Love, with them abide,
In Thee for ever may they hide
For even death cannot divide
Those whom Thou makest one.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.7.6
And God even our own God shall bless us Ps.  67:6

We raise our hear and voices
Unto our creator
For the sake of Thy servant
In prayer and praise

Joy for the love giv'n to men
And the heavenly joy
Praise for unnumber'd blessings
And love that surpass love,

Let their collective prayers
May be a lasting made
And let them unite in love
Let them unite in Thee.

Lord accomplish their prayer
And their promises made
To where their faith will ascend
And lasting joy exist

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.7.D
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.D
For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother and shall be joined unto his wife Eph 5:31

O Lord, put Thy seal upon
This wedlock that we witness
In Thy honour, meet with us
Bless their promises of love
Make this fellowship holy
For them and also with Thee

Thou wert present in Cana
In a marriage, just as this
Meet with us while we are here
Thou, the fountain of blessings
Adorn this marriage with joy
Such as the world cannot give.

Not for miracle we ask
Such as water be made wine
But all of our heart desire
Is that we taste of Thy love
May Thy pow'r divide, we pray
Make joy our natural; love.

O Lord, from today onward
Husband and wife let us be
How ever long it may be
To the very end with Thee.
In the land of rest above
In Thy home high up in heav'n

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.4.6.6.6.4.
It is not good that man should be alone, l will make his an help fit for him,Gen.2:18

In th' Edenic garden.
We find this blest command
Thy Ordinance,
Two should come together dwell
And they together dwell
And they together walk
Here in this world

We are assembled here
For us Thy will to do;
Like in the past
Come down, O Lord we pray
Be present in or midst.
With Thy gracious blessings
Descend, we pray.

That this two persons who
Are ready to he joined
Might live for Thee
At all time; teach them their
Duty to each other,
Continue to join them
Through all their life

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: For in Cana of Galilee
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
For in Cana of Galilee
At that blest marriage feast
Jesus was present in that place
And His disciples too.

Jesus reveal Thyself we pray
At this holy wedding
And bestow all of Thy blessing
Upon husband and wife

Let them both be in fellowship
All the days of their life,
Let Thy divine love be the tie
That the world cannot break

That they may one another help
By working together
Grant them Thy peace, O Lord, we pray
And true satisfaction

Like the first blessings Thou give in
The Garden of Eden
That they may go and multiply
Until their lives shall end

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Jesus, do manifest Thyself
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Jesus, do manifest Thyself
At this matrimony
We beseech Thee to come, O Lord
Reveal Thyself to us

Pour Thy blessing upon these ones
Whose hands are joined in ones
Look down in favour of their match
And bless this their union

Fill both their bosoms with Thy love
Give to them Thy peace
O Lord, we pray
And supply all their needs,

Through Thy perfect love, make them one
That they ,may by Christ's love,
Make domestic care become light
By helping each other.

Let them be help to each other
In matter of their faith
And bless thou them with good children
Who will stablish their home.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
5.6.5
Thou shalt lie down and thy sleep shall be sweet prov.3:24

Now the day is over,
Night is drawing nigh,
Shadows of the evening
Steal across the sky.

Now the darkness gathers,
Stars their watches keep,
Bride and beasts, and flower
Soon will be asleep,

Jesus, give the weary
Calm and sweet repose;
With Thy tend'rest blessing
May mine eyelids close

Grant to little children
Visions bright of Thee
Guard the sailors tossing
On the deep blue sea

Comfort every suffer
Watching late in pain:
Those who plan some evil
From their sin restrain,

Through the morning wakens,
May Thine angles spread
Their white wings above me,
Watching round my bed.

When the morning  wakens,
Then may I arise
pure and fresh, and sinless
In Thy holy eyes

Glory to the Father,
Glory to the son,
And to Thee, blest sprit,
Whilst all ages run

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: By cool Siloam's shady rill
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
By cool Siloam's shady rill
How sweet the lily grows!
How sweet the breath, beneath the hill,
Of Sharon's dewy rose!

Lo! Such the child whose early feet
The paths of peace have trod,
Whose secret heart with influence sweet
I s upward drawn to God.

di	By cool Siloam's shady rill
The lily must decay,
The rose that blooms beneath the hill
Must shortly fade away:

O Thou whose infant feet were found
With Thy Father's shrine,
Whose years, with changeless virtue crowned,
Were all alike divine,

Dependent on Thy bounteous breath,
We seek Thy grace alone,
c	In childhood, manhood, age, and death,
To keep us still Thine own.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
5.6.5
For who hath despised the day of small things Zech. 4:10

Little drops of water,
Little grains of sand,
Make the might ocean
And the beauteous land.

And the little moments,
Humble though they be,
Make they might ages
of eternity

np	Little deeds of kindness
Little words of love,
Make our earth an Eden
Like the heav'n above

So our Little errors
Lead the soul astray
From the paths of virtue
Into sin to stray,

Little seeds of mercy
Sown by youthful hands
Grow to bless the nations
For in heathen lands.

Little ones in glory
Swell the angles' song;
Make us meet dear Saviour's
Far their holy throng.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
11.11.11.
I am the good shepherd. Joh.10:11

Jesus is our Shepherd wiping every tear,
Folded in His bosom, what have we to us
Only let us follow whithe He doth lead,
To the us the dewy mead,

Jesus is our Shepherd, for the sheep He bled;
Every lamb is sprinkled with the blood He shed
Then on each He seateth His own secret sign:
They that here My sprit, these, saith He, are Mine.

Jesus is our Shepherd; Guarded by His arm,
Through the wolves may ravin, none can do us harm:
When we tread death's valley, dark with fearful gloom,
We will fear no evil victors o'er the tomb.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
5.6.5
And ye shall know the truth  and the truth shall make you free .Joh 8.321

Jesus meek and gentle ,
Son of God most High
Pitying, loving Saviour,
Hear Thy children's cry.

Pardon our offences,
Loose our captive chains
Break down every idol
Which our soul detains.

Give us holy freedom
Fill our hearts with love;
Draw us, holy Jesus,
To the realms above

Lead us on our journey,
Be thyself the way
Through terrestrial darkness
To celestial day

Jesus meek and gentle
Son of God most High,
Pitying, loving Saviour's,
Hear Thy children's cry,

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.8.6
Learn of me for l am meek and lowly in heart Matt.11:29

I want to be like Jesus,
So lowly and so meek,
For no one makes an angry word
That ever heard Him speak.

I want to be like Jesus,
So frequently in prayer;
Alone upon the mountain- top,
He met His Father there,

I want to be like Jesus,
I never, never find
That He, though persecuted, was
To any one unkind

I want to be Jesus,
Engaged in doing good,
So that of it may be said
"She hath done what the could"

I want to be like Jesus,
Who sweet said to all,
Let little children come to me"
I would obey the call.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7
And he look them up in his arms and he blessed them Mark.10:16

Jesus loves me, this l know,
For the Bible tells me so;
Little ones to Him belong,
They are weak, but He is strong.
Yes, Je-sus loves me!
Yes, Je-sus loves me!
Yes, Je-sus loves me!
The Bi-ble tells me so!

Jesus loves me, He who died
Heaven's gate to open wide;
He will wash away my sin,
Let this little child come in.

Jesus loves me, love me still,
Though I'm very weak and ill,
From His shining throne on high
He will watch me where l lie.

Jesus loves me, He will stay,
Close beside me all the way,
Then His little child will take
Up to heav'n for His dear sake.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 6.8.5.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.8.5.&.Ref.
And they shall be mine, saith the Lord of host Mal.3:17

When He cometh, when He cometh.
To make up His jewels,
All His jewels, precious jewels,
His loved and His own
Like the stars of the morning,
His bright Crown adorning,
They shall shine in their beauty,
Bright gems for His Crown,

He will gather, He will gather
The gems for His Kingdom,
All the pure ones, all the bright ones,
His loved and His own

Little children, little children
Who love their Redeemer,
Are the jewels, precious jewels,
His loved and His own

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.7.7.
Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea. Matt 2:l

Once in royal David's city
Stood a lowly cattle-shed,
Where a mother laid her baby
In a manger for His bed
Mary was that mother mild,
Jesus Christ her little child.

He came down to earth from heaven.
Who is God and Lord of all,
And His shelter was a stable,
And His cradle was a stall,
With the poor, and mean, and lowly
Live on earth our Saviour holy.

And through all His wondrous childhood
He would honour and obey
Love and watch the lowly maiden
In whose gentle arms He lay
Christian children all must be
Mild, obedient, good as He

And our eyes at last shall see Him,
Through His own redeeming love;
For that child so dear and gentle
Is our Lord I heaven above?
And He leads His children on
To the place where He is gone

Not in poor lowly stable,
With the oxen standing by,
We shall see Him; but in Heaven,
We at God's right hand o high;
When like stars His children crown'd
All in shall wait around.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.7.6.7.6.7.6.
All are your ye are Christ's 1 cor.3:22&.23

There's a friend for little children
Above the bright blue sky;
A friend who never changes
Whose love can never die
Unite our friend by nature,
Who change with changing years,
This friend is always worthy
The precious name he bears.

There's a rest for little children
Above the bright blue sky
For those love the Saviour,
And abba Father cry
di	A rest from every trouble
From sin and danger free,
Where every little pilgrim
Shall rest eternally.

There's a home for little children
Above the bright blue sky
Where Jesus reigns in glory;
A home on peace and joy
di	 No home on earth is like it
Nor can with it compare
For every one is happy
Nor can be happier there.

There's a crown for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
And all who look to Jesus
Shall wear it by and by
A Crown of brightest glory
Which he will then bestow
On those who found his favour,
And loved him here below

There's a song for little children
Above the bright blue sky
A song that which will not weary
Though sung continually;
A song which even sing,
Can never, never sing,
They know not Christ as Saviour
But worship him as king,

There's a robe for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
A harp of sweetest music,
A palm of victory
All, all above is treasured,
And found in Christ alone
Oh, come, dear little children
That all may be your own

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.6.6.8.8
Speak Lord for Thy servant heareth. 1 sam.3:9

When little Samuel woke
And heard his master's voice
At ev'ry word he spoke
How much did he rejoice
Oh, blessed happy child to find
The God of heav'n so near and kind

If God would speak to me
And say He is my Friend
How happy l should be
Oh how would l attend
How smallest Sin l then should be
If God Almighty were so near.

And does He never speak?
Oh, yes for His word
He bids me come and seek
The God that Samuel heard
In almost ev'ry page l see
The God of Samuel calls to me.

And l beneath His care
May safely rest my head
l know that God is there
To guard my humble bed
And every sin l well may fear
Since God Almighty is so- near.

Like Samuel let me say
When'er ; read Thy word
Speak, Lord l would obey
The voice that l have heard
And when l in Thy servant wait to hear

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: There is a path lead to God,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
It leads straight through this world of sin,
And danger must be pass'd;
But whose who boldly walk therein
Will get to heav'n at last

How shall an infant pilgrim dare
This dangerous path to tread?
For on the way's many a snare
For youthful  travellers spread.

White the broad road where thousands go,
Lies near and opens fair,
And many turn aside, l know,
To walk with sinners there

But least my feeble steps should slide,
Or wander from thy way,
Lord, condescend to be my guide,
And l shall never stray

Then l may go without alarm
And trust His word of old
"The lambs, He'll gather with His arm,
And lead them to the fold"

Thus l may safely venture through
Beneath my Shepherd's care
And keep the gate of heav'n in view,
Till l shall enter there

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Around the throne of God in heaven
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Around the throne of God in heaven
Thousands of children stand,
Children, whose sins are all forgiven,
A holy, happy band
Singing: Glory, glory, glory!
Singing: Glory, glory, glory!

In flowing robes of spotless white
See every one arrayed,
Dwelling in everlasting light
And joys that never fade.

What  brought them to that world above
That heav'n so bright and fair,
Where all is peace, and joy and love?
How came those children there/

Because the Saviour shed His
Blood to wash away their sin;
Bath'd in that pure and precious flood,
Behold them white and clean.

On earth they sought the Saviour grace
On earth they lov'd His name;
So now they see His blessed face,
And stand before the lamb.

And is that fountain flowing yet?
Bless'd Saviour, lead us there;
That we those happy ones may meet,
And in their praises share.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Jesus, who lived above the sky,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Jesus, who lived above the sky,
Came down to be a man and die;
And in the Bible we may see
How very good He used to be.

He went about- He was sso kind
To cure poor people who were blind;
And many who them and were sick and lame,
He pitied them and did the same.

And more than that, He told them, too
The thing that God would have them do;
And was so gentle and so mild,
He would have listened to a child.

But such a cruel death He died!
He was hung up and crucified!
And those kind Hands that did such good
They nailed them to a cross of wood

And so He died!-and this is why
He came to be a Man and die!
The Bible says He came from Heav'n
That we might have our sins forgiven

He knew how wicked man had been,
And knew that God must punish sin;
So, out of pity, Jesus said
He'd bear the punishment instead.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Be present at our table, Lord,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Be present at our table, Lord,
Be here and every where adore;
Bless these Thy gift and grant that we
May feast in paradise with Thee

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: We thank Thee, Lord, for this our food,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Jesus we come to Thee
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Jesus we come to Thee
On this Thy holy day,
Come Thou to us as here we meet
And teach us by Thyself.

Forgive us all our sins,
Send Thy Sprit to us
Teach us that here may be the star
Of the life without end

Fill all our hearts with lover,
Accept our teacher's work,
That we and him may meet above
In Thy presence on high

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Oh Lord, our hearts would give Thee praise
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Oh Lord, our hearts would give Thee praise
Ere now our school we end,
For this Thy day, the best of days
Jesus, the children's Friend

Lord grant Thy word in every heart,
Our souls from sin defend,
That we from Thee may ne'er depart,
Jesus, the children's Friend

Lord bless our homes and give us grace,
Thy Sabbaths so to spend,
That we in heav'n may find a place,
With Thee, the children's Friend.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
5.6.5
Resist the devil and he will flee from you. James 4:7

Do no sinful action
Speak no angry word;
Ye belong to Jesus
Children of the Lord

Christ is kind and gentle,
Christ is pure and true ;
And His little children
Must be holy too.

But ye must not hear him,
Though 'tis hard for you
To resist the evil,
And the good to do

For ye promised truly,
In your infant days
To renounce him wholly,
And to do the right

Ye are Christian soldiers,
Ye must learn to fight
With His little children
Must be holy too.

Christ is your own Master
He is good and true,
And His  little children
Must be holy too.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Hosanna! raise the pealing hymn
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Hosanna! raise the pealing hymn
To David's son and Lord;
With Cherubim and Seraphim
Exalt the incarnate word.

Hosanna! Lord, our feeble tongue
No lofty strains can raise;
But Thou wilt not despise the young
Who meekly chant Thy praise.

Hosanna! Sovereign, prophet, priest,
How vast Thy gifts, how free!
Thy blood, our life; Thy word, our feast;
Thy name our only plea.

Hosanna! Master, lo, we bring
Our offering to Thy throne;
Not gold, nor myrrh, nor mortal thing,
But hearts to be thine own.

Hosanna! once Thy gracious ear
Approved a lisping throng;
Be gracious still, and deign to hear
Our poor but grateful song

O Saviour, if, redeemed by Thy,
Thy temple we behold,
Hosannas through eternity
We'll sing to harp of gold.
Amen.
\

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
4.8.4.8.8.8.4
And there is a friend who sticketh closer than a brother Prov. 18:24

one there is above al other
Oh, how He lovers!
His is love beyond a brother's
Earthy friends may fail or  leave us,
One day soothe, the next day give us,
But this friend will ne'er deceive us'
Oh, how He loves!

'Tis eternal life to know Him,
Oh, how He loves!
di	Think, o think how much we owe Him,
Oh, how He loves!
With His precious Blood He bought us,
In the wilderness He safely sought us
To His fold He safely brought us,
Oh, how He loves!

Through His Name we are forgiven
Oh, how He loves!
Backward shall our foes be driven,
Oh, how He loves!
Best of blessing He'll provide us,
Nought but good shall e'er betide us,
Safe to glory He will guide us,
Oh, how He loves!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: See Israel's gentle shepherd stand
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
See Israel's gentle shepherd stand
With all-engaging charms;
Hark! how He calls the tender lambs,
And folds them in His arms.

Permit them to approach, He cries
Nor scorn their humble name!
For 'twas to bless such souls as these
The Lord of angles came.

We Bring them Lord, in thankful hand
And yield them up to thee;
Joyful that we ourselves are Thine,
Thine let our children be.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7
There the Lord command the blessing even life for evermore Ps 133:3

Heav'nly Father may Thy love
Shine upon us from above
Let this infant find a place
In Thy covenant of grace

Son of God with us here
Listen to our humble prayer
Let Thy blood on Calvary spilt
Cleanse this child from nature's guilt

Holy Ghost to Thee we cry
Thou this infant sanctify
Thine Almighty pow'r display
Seal him to redemption's day

Great Jehovah, Father Son
Holy Sprit, Thee in one
Let the blessing come from Thee
Thine shall all the glory be.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.6.8.8.11.
Permit little children to come unto me Luk 18:16

When mother of Salem
Their children brought to Jesus,
The stern disciples drove them back
And bade them depart;
But Jesus saw them ere they fled,
And sweetly smiled and kindly said,
"Suffer little children to come unto me"

"For l will receive them,
And fold them in My bosom;
I'll be a Shepherd to those lambs,
Oh, drive them not away!
For if their heart to Me they give.
They shall with Me in glory live,
"Suffer little children to come unto me"

How kind was our Saviour
To bid those children welcome!
But there are many thousands
Who have never heard His name;
The Bible they have never read;
How kind not that the Saviour said,
"Suffer little children to come unto me"

Oh! soon may the neathen
Of every tribe and nation
Fulfill Thy blessed word,
Oh!, shine upon them from above,
And show Thyself a God of love,
Teach the little children to come unto Thee.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
5.6.5.
Permit little children to come unto me, and forbid them not, Mk. 10:14.

Jesus, high glory,
Lend a list'ning ear;
When we bow before Thee,
Children's praises hear.

Though Thou are so holy,
Heav'n's almighty King,
Thou wilt stoop to listen
When Thy praise we sing.

We are little children
Weak and apt to stray;
Saviour, guide and keep us
IN the heav'nly way.

Then, when Thou shalt call us
To our heav'nly home,
We will gladly answer,
Saviour, Lord, we come!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
4.10.4.10.10.
Teach me Thy way, O Lord, and lead me in a plain path Ps. 27:11

Jesus, who calledst little ones to Thee,
To Thee I come,
O take my hand in thin, and speak to me,
And lead me home;
Lest form the path of life my feet
And Satan prowling make Thy lamb his prey.

I love to thing that Thou with holy feet
My path hast trod,
Along life's common lanes and dusty street
Hast walk'd with God,
On Mary's bosom drawn baby's breath,
And ser'vd Thy parents dear at Nazareth.

O gentle Jesus, make this heart of mine,
So full of sin,
As holy, harmless, undefiled, as Thine
And dwell therein,
Then God my Father,  like Thee, shall know,
And grow in wisdom as in strength I grow.

To Thee, my Saviour, the, with morning light
Glad songs I'll raise,
My saddest hours and darkest shall be bright
With silent praise;
And should my work or play my thoughts employ,
Thy will shall be my law, Thy love my joy.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
And Jesus called a little child unto Him, Matt. 18:2.

Gentle Jesus, meek and mild
Look upon a little child
Pity my simplicity
Suffer me to come to Thee

di	Fain I would to Thee be brought
Blessed Lord, forbid it not
In the Kingdom of Thy grace
Give a little child a place.

Fain I would be as Thou art
Give me Thy obedient heat
Thou art pitiful and kind
Let me have Thy loving mind.

Above all O Jesus Christ
Let me do my Father's will
Not to frustrate the spirit
And Thy glory to be shown.

Lam of God, I took to Thee
Thou shalt my example be
Thou art gentle, meek, and mild
Thou wast once a little child.

Loving Jesus, gentle Lamb
In Thy gracious hand I an
Make me Saviour what Thou art
Live Thyself within my heart.

The praise, O Lord will I show
I will serve Thee all my days
The world shall see Jesus Christ
Father's holy son in me.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Blessed Jesus, here we stand,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Blessed Jesus, here we stand,
Met to do as Thou hast spoken;
And this child, at Thy command,
Now we bring to Thee in token
That to Christ it here id given.,
For of such shall be His heaven.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: When Jesus enter'd the Temple
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
When Jesus enter'd the Temple
The shout of praise, we heard
The children acknowledge His right
And they rejoic'd in Him.

Hosannah raise the Temple high
And mixed with divers tongues
Hosannah to the King of heav'n
Unto the David's seed

Renew our days, O Lord In Thee
O when children praise Thee
Great is Thy strength and goodness Lord
As in the days of old

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.
I am the good shepherd. Joh. 10:14

Jesus, Thou that feedeth Thy flock
Like the kind and good shepherd
Who gives to them Thy tender care
And embraces the young ones

Receive these children, we pray Thee
Draw them to Thy dear embrace
We have the blest assurance that
No evil can harm them there

There, they will go astray,
The lion will not hunt them,
And let Thy compassionate love
Be their portion all their life

In Thy green pastures up on high
Let them find a place of rest
Let them eat the green, tender grass
And drink water of Thy love.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: O God the throne of Thy glory
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
O God the throne of Thy glory
Shall for ever exist
Our parents all are very poor
Give us Thy blessings now

As it please Thee to make us poor
We now beseech The Lord
To be our Master and our friend
When we are in the world

We know that we belong to Thee
And we are called by Thee
We are but strangers now make us
Thy chosen children be

Come Thou Our Shepherd visit us
Preserve Thy little flock
Lead us with Thy rod and Thy staff
We children of Thy flock.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.8.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.D.
Out of the mouth of babes, and sucklings hast thou ordained strength. Ps. 8:2

Jehovah, the Lord of glory
Let the children praise Thy name
We humbly bow down before Thee
Thy great goodness is our song,
Seraph, hosts, join us in praising
His loving kindness on high,
O Lord, God of glory hear us
As we praise Thy holy name.

Emmanuel, Thou who art born
And then hanged upon the cross,
Thou hast called the little children
That they should come unto Thee
Lord, we have come to answer Thee
Let us Thy mercy receive,
That we and all Thy dear children
Come to love and serve Thee best,

O, that we would live to love Thee
And to fear Thee all our life,
And at last come and dwell with Thee
Behold Thee and praise Thy name
Jesus, Thou God of all comforts
The greatest, of friends, arise
Bless us with Thy great salvation
And accept our hymns of praise.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Ye little ones keep close to God
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Ye little ones keep close to God
In trembling and humility,
Let all knees bow down before Him
Our Lord and Saviour and our friend.

O Saviour, let Thy great mercy
Fill us with gratitude to Thee
And in our pilgrimage on earth
May we receive more of Thy grace.

O Saviour, may all evil thoughts
Be far away flung from our hearts,
And each day, give us Thy wisdom
To choose to walk the narrow way

In times of sickness and good health,
In times of plenty or in nee,
And when the hour of death shall come
Deliver us with Thy great pow'r.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
4.8.
The day goeth away, the shadow of the evening are stretched out. Jer. 6:4.

Today is past
Our Lord Jesus
Behold me now
The little child

Thou art the light
Look upon me
Let Thy light shine
Upon me Lord

My dear Saviour
I'll never fear
Because Thou art
Now by my side

And everytime
I watch Thy face
When there is none
To be with me

And everytime
Incline Thine ears
Unto the pray'rs
Of little ones

And now therefore
Without terror
I slept and I
Rest upon Thee

Thou, Father, Son,
And Holy Ghost
Worthy of praise,
In earth and heav'n.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Stand up, arise and let us sing
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Stand up, arise and let us sing
Sing praise unto our Lord;
And let us give thanks unto Him
For keeping us alive

Stand up, arise and let us sing
Sing praise unto our Lord'
And let us give thanks unto Him
For all His holy word

Stand up, arise and let us sing
Sing praise unto our Lord'
Let us ask for heavenly help
And His sure protection

Stand up, arise and let us sing
Sing praise unto our Lord'
May all that we have learnt today
Be to our benefit.

Stand up, arise and let us sing
Sing praise unto our Lord'
May Thy blessing fall upon us
As we go to our homes.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: After six days that He has worked
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
After six days that He has worked
He rested on the seventh day;
He commanded us do the same
And keep that day, hallow'd for Him

We want to fulfil that command
In this Thy holy house today;
As long as we are here today
Let us know that Thou art here too.

As we open Thy holy book
Let us read with humility,
Let us know that Thou speaks to us
And let us listen to Thy word.

Show us the meaning by Thyself,
We are so simple and unwise;
Thy words are very deep indeed
And our understanding is small.

Come and be with all our teachers,
Annoint them with Thy Holy Ghost
Give them the understanding, Lord
However deep Thy word may be.

And when we shall depart this place
Please, Lord, be with us on our way,
That we may keep remembering Thee
Until another Sunday School

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
10.
Then cometh the wicked one and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart.Matt.13:19

Jesus our king, our lesson now is o'er,
Do not allow the devil pick it up.

Jesus our king, we give our thanks to Thee,
As Thou has given us the bread of life.

Jesus our king, no teaching is like Thine,
Thy testimonies are so sweet to us.

Jesus our king, unto Thee we shall look,
Thus Thou has taught us to do in Thy word.

Jesus our king, as we depart for home,
We pray, keep us safely under Thy wings.

Jesus our king, keep us throughout the week,
And bring us back again the coming week.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
O how I love Thee well,
I am happy, it makes me glad
To rejoice at Thy birth.

O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
Thy friendship suits me well;
Both young and old will sing Thy song
We long for Sunday School.

O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
Christ was Thy first teacher,
The Holy Spirit, great teacher
Does manifest in thee.

O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
This testimony's sure,
That God, the Father Almighty,
Poured His blessing on thee.

O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
Though the sun be so bright
Or if the clouds be black with rain,
I'll be in Sunday School

O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
I rejoice to see thee,
Will Thou pass over me today
Without my being blest?

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
5.6.5.
Give ear, o shepherd of Israel.Ps.80:1

Faithful Shepherd, feed me
In the pastures green;
Faithful Shepherd, lead me
Where Thy Steps are seen

Hold me fast and guide me
In the narrow way,
So, with Thee beside me,
I shall never stray.

Daily bring me nearer
To the Heav'nly shore;
May I love grow dearer,
May I love Thee more.

Give me joy or sadness,
This be all my care,
That Eternal gladness
I with Thee may share.

Day by day prepare me,
As Thou seest best,
Then let Angels bear me
To Thy promised rest

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
Lo, children are an heritage from the Lord, and the fruit of the womb is his reward. Ps. 127:3

Hear Thou our prayer O Lord
For the children giv'n to us
Allot them in Thy blessing
And joy of heav'n give to them

Let their souls draw nigh to Thee
When they are little children
Let Thy glory be made down
At their youthful time O Lord

With the blood of the Saviour
Wash their souls and makes them clean
Regenerated to be
That they may be Thine alone

Now we plead for Thy mercy
O Lord answer our request
Our souls now rest upon Thee
In mercy hear our requests.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Jesus call'd little ones
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Jesus call'd little ones
Laid them on His bosom
And He embraced them in His arms
And gave them His blessings

Jesus receive this child
That we bring in Thy house
Make him Thine own, and let him grow
For Thy glory O Lord

O Lord, when our children
And before Thee appear
Give children to all the barrens
And bless us ere we go.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.
And if we are His children, then we are heirs. Rom. 8:17

Our great Captain and our Saviour
These children we give to Thee
Pray, make them fit Thy service
Heirs off life these children are

Thou the beauty of the Father
These children we give to Thee
Create them in Thy own image
Prepared for Thy courts above.

Make them valiant warriors for Thee,
Soldiers brave and strong we pray,
Strong to vanquish hosts of Satan
And to overcome the world

Let Thy words like coals of fire
In the mouth of Thy children
Burn sin totally to ashes
That our bodies be made whole

Keep them all for Thy glorious work
And that spotless they may be;
Teach them all how to bear the cross
Each day they live here on earth

Bless'd be the plan of salvation
For the good of these Thy youth;
Deliver them, lead them, watch them
And at last, do save their souls

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
Thou art no more servant but a son Gal. 4:7.

Children of the heav'nly King,
As ye journey, sweetly sing;
Sing your Saviour's worthy praise,
Glorious in His works and way

We are travelling home to God
In the way the fathers trod;
They are happy now, and we
Soon their happiness shall see

Lift your eyes, ye sons of light,
Zion's city is in sight;
There our endless home shall be,
There Lord we soon shall see,

Fear not, brethren, joyful stand
On the borders of your land;
Jesus Christ, your Father's Son,
Bids your undismayed go on.

Lord, obediently we go,
Gladly leaving all below;
Only Thou our leader be,
And we still will follow Thee.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.6.6.
Lord, I have loved the habitation of Thy house, where thy honour dwelleth.
Ps. 26:8.

We love the place, O God,
Wherein Thine honour dwells
The joy of Thine abode
All earthly joy excels,

It is the house of prayers
Wherein Thy servants meet;
And Thou, O Lord, art there
Thy chosen flock to greet

We love the sacred font,
For there the Holy Dove,
Pours out, as He is wont,
The effluence form above

We love our Father's board,
Oh what on earth so dear!
Where faithful hearts, O Lord,
Still find Thy presence near.

We love the word of life,
The word that tells of peace,
Of comfort in the strife,
And joys that never cease.

We love to sing below
For mercies freely given,
But oh! we long to know
The triumph-song of heaven

Lord Jesus, give us grace
Oh earth to love Thee more,
In heaven to see Thy face,
And with Thy saints adore.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Jesus whe'er Thy people meet,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Jesus whe'er Thy people meet,
There they behold Thy mercy-seat,
Where'er they seek Thee Thou art found
And every place is hallowed ground

For Thou, within no wall confined,
Inhabitest the humble minds;
Such ever bring Thee where they come,
And going take Thee to their home.

Dear Shepherd of Thy chosen few
Thy former mercies here renew;
Here to our waiting hearts proclaim
The sweetness of Thy saving name

Here may we prove the pow'r of pray'r
To strength faith and sweeten to care,
To teach our faint desires to rise,
And bring all heav'n before our eyes

Lord, we are few, but Thou art near,
Nor short Thine arm, nor deaf Thine ear,
O rend the heav;ns, come quickly down,
And make a thousand hearts Thine own!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.6.7
There shall be showers of blessing. Ezek. 34:26.

Lord, I hear of showers of blessing
Thou art scattering, full and free;
Showers, the thirsty land refreshing,
Let some drops now fall on me
Even me, even me,
Let some drops now fall on me.

Pass me not, O gracious Father,
Sinful though my heart may be;
Thou might'st leave me, but the rather
Let Thy mercy light on me

m	Pass me not, O mighty Spirit,
Thou canst make the blind to see;
Witness of the Saviour's merit,
Speak the word of power to me

Have I long in sin been sleeping,
Long been slighting, grieving Thee?
Has the world my heart been keeping?
Oh! forgive and rescue me.

Love of God so pure and changeless,
Blood of Christ so rich, so free,
Grace of God so strong and boundless,
di	Magnify it all in me

Pass me not, but pardon bringing,
Bind my heart, O Lord, to Thee,
All my heart to Thee is springing,
Blessing others, oh! bless me,

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
11.11.11.
Revive me according to Thy word. Ps. 119:25

More holiness give me, more
strivings within,
More patience in suffering,
more sorrow for sin;
More faith in my Saviour, more sense of His care;
More joy in His service, more
purpose in prayer.

More gratitude give me, more trust
in the Lord
More zeal for His glory, more hope
in his word,
More tears for His sorrows, more pain at His grief;
More meekness in trial, more praise
for relief.

More purity give me, more strength
to o'ercome;
More freedom from earth-stains,
more longings for home;
More meet for Thy kingdom OLord, would I be,
More fruitful, more holy, more
Saviour, like Thee.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 8.10.8. & Ref
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.10.8. & Ref
Casting all your care upon Him. 1Pet.5:7

Tell it to Jesus, all of thy sorrow,
All of thy cares whate'er they be;
Surely and sweetly, He will deliver
He will sustain and comfort thee.
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus]
Tell it to Jesus, He will hear,.
Only believe Him trust and receive Him,
He will sustain and comfort thee.

Tell it to Jesus, He is thy Saviour,
Tell it, and his salvation see;
Do not deny Him, do not defy Him
He will sustain and comfort thee.

Tell ii to Jesus, He is a refuge,
Into His arms for mercy flee;
Tell it believing, tell it receiving
Grace to sustain and comfort thee.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.8.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.D.
And the Lord shall guide thee continually. Isa.53:11.

Thou hast promised to receive us,
Poor and sinful though we be;
Thou hast mercy to relieve us,
Grace to cleanse, and make us free,
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Early let us turn to Thee.
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Early let us turn to Thee.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.8.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.D.
Ye are my friends. Joh. 15:14

What a Friend we have in Jesus,
All our sins and griefs' to bear
What a privilege to carry
Everything to God in prayer!
O what peace we often forfeit
O what needless pain we bear,
All because we do not carry
Everything to God in prayer!

Have we trials and temptations!
Is there trouble anywhere?
We should never be discouraged
Take it to the Lord in prayer.
Can we fin a friend so faithful,
Who will all our sorrows share?
Jesus knows our every weakness
Take it to the Lord in prayer.

Are we weak and heavy-laden,
Cumbered with a load of care
Precious Saviour, still our refuge
Take it to the Lord in prayer.
Do thy friends despise, forsake thee/
Take it to the Lord in prayer.
In His arms He'll take and shield thee,
Thou wilt find a solace there.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 8.8.8.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.8.D.
Pray without ceasing. 1 Thess. 5:17

Jesus the Son, Lord of us all
Who is always the same ever
Give ear to the cry of Thy child
And teach us how to pray to Thee,
Give us a heart that prays to Thee,
Wake us early to seek Thy face.

di	We cannot think any good thought
Our intentions cannot be good
Except Thou our Creator put
Such grace and goodness deep within;
Then we shall have a like Thine,
Compassionate, yielded to Thee,

di	Jesus, listen to the complaint
Of Thy, own in severe trial
Give those things we do not possess
Send the blessed Comforter down
Give to us a spirit of prayer
Send Thy Holy Ghost to our souls.

Send the Holy Spirit to us
Make us a part of Thy body
That all our ailment may be stemmed,
That sinner's anxious thoughts may cease
Pow'r to prevail with Thee in prayer,
Until our heart is house of prayer

Come down in the spirit of prayer,
To us who are seeking for Thee,
The grace to prevail in our prayer,
Is our earnest supplication,
Endow us with this, Lord Jesus
Thou will supply all other things.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Shepherd divine, our wants relieve
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Shepherd divine, our wants relieve
In this our evil day,
To all Thy tempted follow'rs give
The pow'rs to watch and pray

Long as our fiery trials last,
Long as the cross we bear,
O let our souls on Thee be cast
In never-casing prayer!

Spirit of interceding grace
Give us in faith to claim,
To wrestle till we see Thy face,
And know Thy hidden name

Till Thou Thy perfect love impart,
Till Thou Thyself bestow,
Be this the cry of every heart,
I will not let Thee go.

I will not let Thee go, unless
Thou tell Thy name to me,
With all thy great salvation bless,
And make me all like Thee!

Then let me on the mountain-top
Behold Thy open face,
Where faith in sight is swallowed up,
And pray'r in endless praise.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
10.
Men ought always to pray and not to faint Luk 18:1

Pray, always pray; the Holy Spirit pleads
Within thee all thy daily hourly needs.

Pray, always, beneath sin's heaviest load
Pray sees the blood from Jesus' side that flow'd

Pray, always pray, though weary, faint, and lone,
Prayer nestless by the Father's shelt'ring throne

Pray, always pray, amid the world's tur-moil
Prayer keep the earth at rest, and nerves for toil

Pray, always pray, if joys thy pathway throng,
Prayer strikes the harp and sings the angel's song

Pray, always pray, if loved one pass the veil
Prayer drinks with them of springs that cannot fail,

di	All earthly things with earth shall fade away
Prayer grasps eternity, pray, always pray.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: From every stormy wind that blows,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
From every stormy wind that blows,
From every swelling tide of woes,
There is a calm, a sure retreat;
'Tis found beneath the mercy-seat.

There is a place where Jesus sheds
The oil of gladness on our heads
A place than all beside more sweet
It is the blood-stain'd mercy-seat.

There is a spot where spirits blend,
And friend holds fellowship with friend,
Though sunder'd far, by faith they meet
Around one common mercy-seat.

Ah, whither could we flee for aid,
When tempted, desolate, dismay'd?
Or how the hosts of hell defeat,
Had suffering saints no mercy-seat

There, there on eagle wing we soar,
And time and sense seem all no more,
And heaven comes down our souls to greet,
And glory crowns the mercy-seat.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 6.7.6.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.7.6.D.
Pray without ceasing. 1 Thess. 5:17

Go when the morning shineth
Go, when the noon is bright,
Go, in the hush of night;
Go, with pure mind and feeling
And in thy chamber kneeling
Do thou in secret pray.

Remember all who love thee,
All who are loved by the;
Pray too for those who hate the,
If any such there be;
Then for thyself in meekness
A blessing humbly claim,
And link with each petition
Thy great Redeemer's name

Or if 'tis here denied thee
In solitude to pray,
Should holy thoughts come o'er thee,
When friends are round thy way,
E'en then the silent pleading
Of thy heart raised above
Will reach His throne of glory,
Who's mercy, truth and love

Oh, not a joy or blessing
With this can we compare;
The pow'r that He has giv'n us
To pour our souls in pray'r
Before His footstool fall,
Remember in thy gladness
His grace who gives thee all.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: There' is an eye that never sleeps
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
There' is an eye that never sleeps
Beneath the wing of night;
There is an ear that never shuts,
When sink the beams of light

There is an arm that never tires,
When human strength gives way;
There is a love that never fails,
When earthly loves decay,

But there's a pow'r which man can wield
When mortal aid is vain,
That eye, that arm, that love to reach,
That list'ning ear to gain

That pow'r is pray'r, which soars on high
Through Jesus to the throne,
And moves the hand, which move the world,
To bring salvation down

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: What various hindrances we meet,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
What various hindrances we meet,
In coming to the mercy-seat
Yet who that knows the worth of prayer
But wishes to be often there?

Pray'r makes the darken'd cloud withdraw
Pray'r climbs the ladder Jacob saw,
Gives exercise to faith and love,
Brings every blessing from above.

Restraining pray'r, we cease to fight,
Pray'r makes the Christian armour bright,
And Satan trembles when he sees
The weakest saint upon his knees.

O Lord, increase our faith and love,
That we may all Thy goodness prove,
And gain from Thy exhaustless store
The fruits of prayer for evermore

Were half the breath thus vainly spent
To heav'n in supplication sent,
Our cheerful song would oftener be,
Hear what the Lord hath done for me.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.4.
Hour of prayer. Act. 3:1

My God, is any hour so sweet,
From blush of morn to evening star,
As that which calls me to Thy feet,
The hour of prayer?

Blest be that tranquil hour of morn,
And blest that hour of solemn eve,
When, on the wings of prayer upborne,
The world I leave.

For then a day-spring shines on me
Brighter than morn's ethereal glow,
And richer dews descend from Thee
Then earth can know

No words can tell what blest relief,
There for my every want I find,
What strength for warfare, balm for grief,

Hush'd is each doubt; gone every fear,
My spirit seems in heaven to stay,
And ev'n the penitential ear
Is wiped away.

Lord, till I reach you blissful shore,
No privilege so dear shall be,
As thus my inmost soul to pour
In prayer to Thee.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
That calls me from a world of care,
And bids me at my Father's throne
Make all my wants and wishes known,
In seasons of distress and grief,
My soul has often found relief,
And oft escaped the tempter's snare
By thy return, sweet hour of prayer,

Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
Thy wings shall my petition bear
To Him whose truth and faithfulness
Engage the waiting soul to bless;
And since He bids me seek His face,
Believe His word and trust His grace,
I'll cast on Him my every care,
And wait for the, sweet hour of prayer.

Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
May I thy consolation share,
Till, from Mount Pisgah's lofty height,
I view my home, and take my flight;
This robe of flesh I'll drop, and rise
To seize the everlasting prize,
And shout, while passing through the air,
Farewell, farewell, sweet hour of prayer.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Behold the throne of grace,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Behold the throne of grace,
The promise calls me near;
There Jesus shows a smiling face,
And waits to answer prayer

That rich atoning blood,
Which sprinkled round l see,
Provides for those who come to God,
An all-prevailing plea

My soul, ask what thou wilt,
Thou canst not be too bold,
Since His own blood for thee He spilt,
What else can he withhold?

Beyond Thine utmost wants,
His love and pow'r can bless;
To praying souls He always grants
More than they can express

Thine image, Lord, bestow,
Thy presence and Thy love;
I ask to serve Thee here below,
And reign with Thee above.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Command Thy blessing from above
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Command Thy blessing from above
O God, on all assemble here
Behold us with a Father's love,
While we look up with filial fear,

Command Thy blessing, in this hour,
