Spirit of truth and fill this place
With humbling and with healing pow'r,
With quick'ning and confirming grace.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee? Luk. 18;41

Be ready to plead Thy cause,
Jesus wants to hear Thy prayer,
He has said that you should pray,
For that reason, He will hear

You are coming to the Kind
Bring all your supplications,
His grace is most abundant
No one ever asks too much

I start with my load of sin,
Lift this great burden of sin
di	Le t the blood that Thou has shed
Wash away my guilt of sin.

I am seeking peace from Thee,
Jesus, Saviour, take my heart,
Establish Thy throne within,
Reign Thou as king in my heart.

In my pilgrimage on earth,
May Thy love my comfort be,
My loving Shepherd and Friend,
Lead me to my journey's end.

Show what you want me to do,
Bestow on me renewed health
Establish me in the faith
Let me die a righteous death.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.8.7.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. 1 Thess. 5:28

Lord, dismiss us with Thy blessing
Fill our hearts with joy and peace,
Let us each, Thy love possessing,
Triumph in redeeming grace;
Oh refresh us, oh refresh us,
Travelling through this wilderness,

Thanks we give, and adoration,
For Thy Gospel's joyful sound;
may the fruits of Thy salvation
In our hearts and lives abound,
May Thy presence, may Thy presence
With us evermore be found.

So, where'er the signal's given,
Us from earth to call away,
Borne on angel's wings to heaven,
Glad the summons to obey,
May we ever, may we ever
Reign with Christ in endless day.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.8.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.D.
But the God of all grace, who hath called us unto His eternal glory by Christ Jesus. 1. Pet 5;10

Come, Thou Fount of every blessing,
Tune my heart to sing thy grace;
Streams of mercy never ceasing
Call for songs of loudest praise,
Teach me some celestial measure
Sung by ransomed hosts above;
O the vast, the boundless treasure
Of my Lord's unchanging love!

Here I raise my Ebenezer,
Hither by Thine help I'm come,
And I hope, by Thy good pleasure,
Safely to arrive at home
Jesus sought me when a stranger,
Wand'ring from the fold of Christ
He, to rescue from danger,
Interpos'd His precious blood.

O to grace how great a debtor
Daily I'm constrained to be!
Let that grace, Lord like a fetter,
Bind my wandering heart to Thee,
Prone to wander, Lord, I feet it,
Prone to leave the God I love,
Take my heart, O take and seal it,
Seal it from thy courts above!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
10.10.10.
The Lord will bless His people with peace. Ps. 29:11

Saviour, again to Thy dear name we raise
With one accord our parting hymn of praise,
We stand to bless Thee ere our worship cease,
Then, lowly kneeling, wait Thy word of peace

Grant us Thy peace, Lord through the coming night,
Turn Thou for us its darkness into light;
From harm and danger keep Thy children free,
For dark and light are both alike to Thee.

Grant us Thy peace, throughout our ear-thy life,
Our balm in sorrow, and our stay in strife,
The, when Thy voice shall bid our con-flict cease,
Call us, O Lord, to Thine eternal peace.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.8.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.D.
Grace of our Lord Jesus Christ.  II Cor. 13:14

May the grace of Christ our Saviour,
And the Father's boundless love,
With the Holy Spirit's favour,
Rest upon us from above,
Thus may we abide in union
With each other and the Lord,
And possess, in sweet communion,
Joys which earth cannot afford.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: When at Thy footstool, Lord, I bend,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
When at Thy footstool, Lord, I bend,
And plead with thee for mercy there,
Think of the sinner's dying Friend,
And for His sake receive my prayer.

Oh think not of my shame and guilt,
My thousand stains of deepest dye;
Think of the blood which Jesus spilt
My pardon and my life to buy

Think, Lord how I am still Thine won,
The trembling creature of Thy hand;
Think how my heart to sin is prone,
And what temptations round me stand.

Oh think upon Thy holy word,
And every plighted promise there;
How pray'r should evermore be heard,
And who Thy glory is to spare.

Oh think not of my doubts and fears
My strivings with thy grace divine;
Think upon Jesus' woes and tears,
And let His merits stand for mine.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Abide among us with Thy grace,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Abide among us with Thy grace,
Lord Jesus, evermore,
Nor let us e'er to sin give place,
Nor grieve Him we adore.

Abide among us with Thy word,
Redeemer whom we love,
Thy help and mercy here afford,
And life with Thee above.

Abide among us with Thy ray,
O Light that lighten'st all,
And let Thy truth preserve our way
Nor suffer us to fall.

Abide with us to bless us stills,
O bounteous Lord of peace,
With grace and pow'r our spirits fill,
Our faith and love increase.

Abide among us as our shield,
O Captain of Thy host,
That to the world we may not yield,
Nor e'er forsake our post.

Abide with us in faithful love,
Our God and Saviour be;
Thy help in need, O let us prove,
And keep us true to Thee.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 5.8.5.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
5.8.5.&.Ref.
Whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be delivered. Joel. 2:32

Pass me not, O gentle Saviour,
Hear my humble cry;
While on others Thou art calling
di	Do not pass me by.
Saviour! Saviour! Hear my
humble cry.
And while others Thou art calling
Do not pass me by.

Let me at a throne of mercy
Find a sweet relief,
Kneeling there in deep contrition,
Help my unbelief.

Trusting only in Thy merit
Would I seek Thy face,
Heal my wounded, broken spirit,
Save me by Thy grace.

Thou the spring of all my comfort,
More than life to me,
Whom have l on earth beside Thee?
Whom in heaven but Thee?

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: I need not lack for inward love
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
I need not lack for inward love
Unto my Saviour who loves me
Thou hast laid down Thy life for me
That a sinner like me may live

If I refuse to love my Lord
Then I shall now ungrateful be
Will His death be in vain on me
Upon all my weakness, Lord.

Lord give Thy Inward love to me
That I may for ever love Thee
And when my days now end on earth
And enter into Thy glory

Jesus Thou art a truly Friend
Thy mercies endure for ever
Unto those that perform Thy will
And in Thy perfect holiness

Thou who destroy'd the sting of death
And the work of Satan destroy'd
Let sin no more reign over me
Forever let me do Thy will.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.7.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.D.
And hearken Thou to the supplication of the servant when they shall pray.  Hear Thou in heaven and forgive. I Kings. 8:30

O Jesus Thou Lamb of God
Thou who endured agony
Thou hast done Thy Father's will
By Thy forgiveness of sins
We now seek for Thy mercy
And from the guilts of our sins
Take us to Thy place of joy
And at last, to love with Thee.

In the trouble of this world
Be Thou our helper O Lord
Save us from all temptations
And from all our enemies
Let us know Thy death's value
That Thou died upon the cross
Every time let our souls be
Thy sufferings to remember.

Let Thy love abide in us
And all souls which have now stray'd
Teach them to know Thy sweetness
Thy life and resurrection which
Thy death hath brought for them
And at last, that they may be
Participants of Thy grace
And for ever reign with The.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
10.10.10.
As for me, I will call upon God and the Lord shall save me. Ps. 55:16.

Heav'nly Father I stretch my hand
There's no other help that is known to me
Thou who covered us with beauty like robe
With Thy blessing O Lord, now put me on.

Head of the church on earth and triumphant
Recreate me with Thy Holy Spirit
Make use of my thoughts, my souls and spirit
That I may do the work, of my calling

O God, Thou Creator of all mankind
O let me find Thee, seek Thee and love Thee
To love and behave well to all people
And to resemble Thee in miracle

Thou Fount of blessing of love and of joy
Make me to shine like sun in Thy Kingdom
And from this world, that I may be for Thee
To have the joy and blessing of the heav'n.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: O help us Lord! each hour of need
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
O help us Lord! each hour of need
Thy heav'nly succour give
Help us in thought and word and deed
Each hour on earth we live

O help us, when our spirits bleed
With contrite anguish sore
And when our hearts are cold and dead
O help us, Lord, the more,

O help us through the pray'r of faith
More firmly to believe
For still the more the servant hath
The more shall be received.

When we as strangers come to Thee
When we prostrate to Thee
The crumbs that dropped from Thy table
Are sufficient for us

But Thou who art merciful God
Will give in abundance
The crumbs that dropped from Thy table
Becomes our joy and light

O help us, Jesus, from on high
We know no help but Thee
O help us to live and to die
As Thine in heav'n to be

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.7.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.D.
Lord, my heart is not haughty, nor my eyes lofty. Ps. 131:1

Saviour, when in dust to Thee
Low we bow the adoring knee,
When, repentant, to the skies
Scare we lift our weeping eyes,
O, by all Thy pains and woe
Suffered once for man below,
Bending from Thy throne on high,
Hear our solemn litany!

By Thy helpless infant years,
By Thy life of want and tears,
By Thy fasting and distress
In the savage wilderness,
By the dread, mysterious hour
Of the subtle tempter's pow'r,-
Turn, O turn a fav'uring eye,
Hear our solemn litany!

By the sacred grief that wept
O'er the grave where Lazarus slept,
By the gracious tears that flowed
Over Salem's loved abode
By the mournful word that told
Treachery lurked within Thy fold,
From Thy seat above the sky,
Hear our solemn litany!

By Thine hour of whelming fear,
By Thine agony of prayer,
By the purple robe of scorn,
By Thy wounds, Thy crown of thorn,
Be the gloom that veiled the skies
O'er the dreadful sacrifice,-
Listen to our humble cry,
Hear our solemn litany!

By Thy deep expiring groan,
By the sealed sepulchral stone,
By the vault whose dark abode
Held in vain the rising God,-
O, from earth to heaven restored,
Mighty God, ascended Lord,
Listen, listen to the cry,
Of our solemn litany!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Thou very paschal Lamb,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Thou very paschal Lamb,
Whose blood for us was shed,
Through whom we out of Egypt came,
Thy ransomed people lead.

Angel of gospel grace,
Fulfil Thy character,
To guard and feed the chosen race,
In Israel's camp appear,

Throughout the desert way
Conduct us by Thy light
Be Thou a cooling cloud by day,
A cheering fire by night.

Our fainting sols sustain
With blessing from above
And ever on Thy people rain
The manna of Thy love.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 8.8.6.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.6.D.
Awake to righteousness, and sin not. 1 Cor. 15:24.

Thou great mysterious God unknown,
Whose love hath gently led me on,
E'en from my infant days,
Mine inmost soul expose to view
And tell me, if I ever knew
The justifying grace.

di	If I have only know Thy fear,
And followed with a heart sincere
Thy drawings from above,
Now, now the further grace bestow,
And let my sprinkled conscience know
Thy sweet forgiving love.

Short of Thy love I would not stop,
A stranger to the gospel hope,
The sense of sin forgiven;
I would not, Lord, my soul deceive,
Without the inward witness live,
That antepast of heaven

If now the Witness were in me,
Would He not testify of Thee
In Jesus reconciled?
And should I not with faith draw nigh,
And boldly Abba, Father cry
And know myself Thy child?

Whate'er obstructs Thy pard'ning love,
Or sin or righteousness, remove,
Thy glory to display;
Mine heart of unbelief convince,
And now absolve me from my sins,
And take them all away.

Father, in me reveal Thy Son.
And to my inmost soul make known
How merciful Thou art;
The secret of Thy love reveal
And by Thine hall'wing Spirit dwell
For ever in my heart.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Hear Thou my pray'r O Lord,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Hear Thou my pray'r O Lord,
And listen to my cry,
Remember now Thy faithful word,
And graciously reply.

Do not in judgement rise
Thy servant's life to scan,
For righteous in Thy spotless eyes
Is found no living man.

I stretch my longing hands
Toward Thy holy place,
With soul athirst, like weary lands
For Thy refreshing grace.

di	Haste Thee, O Lord, I pray
My failing heart to save!
Hide not Thy face: I droop as they
That sink unto the gave

The mercy's early light
My faith desires to see;
O let me walk before Thy sight!
I lift my soul to Thee.

m	Let Thy good Spirit lead
My feet in righteous ways,
And for Thy name's sake, Lord my head
Above my troubles raise.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.D.
The Lord is my portion, therefore will I hope in Him. Lam. 3:24

Jesus Shepherd of Thy Sheep
Be merciful unto me
Lead me and preserve me Lord
Till Thy love is perfected
Make me to live well in Thee
Let my faith be perfected.

I can't wait any longer
In faith I'm pleading to Thee
But Thou Lord remain the same
The past today and future
Make me steadfastly to be
Strengthen my soul with Thy grace.

Let Thy faith wait any longer
In the world's tribulation
Let holy expectation
Be the anchor of my soul
Make me perfect of my soul
And for ever to the Thine.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
11.11.11.
That in all things, he might have the preeminence. Col. 1:18.

Be Thou my Vision, O Lord of my heart,
Naught be all else to me, save that Thou art,
Thou my best thought, by day or by night,
Walking or sleeping, Thy presence my light.

Be Thou my battle-shield, sword for the fight,
Be Thou my dignity, Thou my delight,
Thou my soul's shelter, Thou my high tower,
Raise Thou me heavenward, O Power of my power.

Riches I heed not, nor man's empty praise
Thou mine inheritance, now and always,
Thou and Thou only, first in my heart always,
High King of heaven, my treasure Thou art.

High King of heaven, after victory won,
May I reach heaven's joys, O bright heaven's Sun!
heart of my own heart, whatever befall,
Still be my Vision, O Ruler of all.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
m	Thou my everlasting Portion
More than friend or life to me
All along my pilgrim journey
Saviour, let me walk with Thee
Close to Thee, close to Thee
Close to Thee, close to Thee
All along my pilgrim journey
Saviour, let me walk with Thee

Not for ease or worldly pleasure
Nor for fame my prayer shall be
Gladly will I toil and suffer
Only let me walk with Thee
Gladly will I toil and suffer
Only let me walk with Thee.

Lead me through the vale of shadows
Bear me o'er life's fitful sea
Then the gate of life eternal
May I enter, Lord with Thee
Then the gate of life eternal
May I enter, Lord with Thee.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.8.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.D.
Draw me after thee, we will make haste. S. Sol. 1:4

Divine Father of all creatures
Hearken Thou unto our pray'rs
With Thy grace and mercy fill us
Thy disciple we may be
Bless us Father we beseech Thee
Answer our supplications
Let us not go empty handed
Bless us with Thy goodness Lord

All those that sought Thee in thy days
No one empty handed went
As their necessity so great
The receiv'd blessing from Thee

Our kneeling ere one before Thee
But with different request came
The informities want reliefs
And the needy wants blessings.

Give unto us, our request now
Lord, as we look unto Thee
That all who are here with joy say
Our requests are now fulfilled.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
I cried to Thee, O Lord. Ps. 30:8

Come, Jesus reveal Thyself
Come, our hearts teach to know Thee
Come, and set our hearts on fire
Come, and bless us ere we part.

Come, put peace within our hearts,
Come, that we all may be blessed
Come, and speak the words of peace,
Come, our faith increase, O Lord,

Come, make all our doubting flee
Come, and teach us how to pray
Come, and fill our hearts with love,
Come, and lift our heats to heaven

Come, and make our hearts rejoice,
Come, and say, "You are my choice,
Come, Thy fold in safety keep
Come, and bless Thy sheep today.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Let us go to the mercy seat,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Let us go to the mercy seat,
And there commune with Christ,
The God of love shows compassion,
To those who worship there

The mercy seat ev'n mercy seat,
There on our bended knees,
God sends the showers of blessing
When ever there we meet.

The mercy seat rejoice ye saints
We'er free to make approach
Pour out your grief before the Lord,
And seek His will to do

We cannot but love mercy seat,
For so long as we live,
Also an interceding Lord,
Until death sets us free.

In heav'n Christ's face will radiate
Light round the mercy seat,
The we shall no more be in want;
Nor need the mercy seat.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
10.11.10.
Because we trust in the living God. 1 Tim. 4:10

To Thee O Lord when morning breaks into light
When birds awoke and the clouds disappear
Above the sun and in the shining of light
With assurance that Thou Lord art with me

And when weariness makes my soul slumbering
Then my request I will bring unto Thee
O how sweet is the sleep under The shadow
But to wake and to see Thee Thou sweets

And so it shall be on the morn of the end
When soul shall rise and the clouds disappear
And then in beauty that exceed the sunshine
Thoughts that I' am with thee" shall now revive.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: O Lord wilt Thou not receive me
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
O Lord wilt Thou not receive me
A wretched man like me
That I may draw night
And cry "Abba Father"

Lord Jesus fill me with Thy word
Turn my darkness to light
Let all my joy return to me
Thrown away with my sins.

I serve Thee Lord wonderfully
Great is Thy goodness Lord
Preserve me Saviour in Thy love
That I may sin no more.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Accept my heart just as it is,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Accept my heart just as it is,
Set up Thy throne therein;
That I love Thee more than the world,
And live for Thee alone,

Complete Thy work, Jesus my Lord,
Faithful, Lord may I be,
That I may hear Thy voice, my Lord,
That is so full of love,

The voice that teaches Thy will and
Tells what I ought to do;
That makes me feel ashamed when I
Fail to walk in Thy path.

Grant that I know these teachings, Lord
That come direct from Thee,
First, teach me yield to Thy voice,
And Thy word of wisdom.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: O Lord my God, hear my complaint
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
O Lord my God, hear my complaint
O listen to my secret pray'rs
To Thee alone, O Lord my King
Will I retire to seek for aid.

In the morning, Thou 'Its hear my pray'r
Quite early, I'll rise with the dawn
I will lift up my eyes to Thee
My supplications I'll present.

But when Thy grace shall bring me o'er
To Thy celestial courts above
Unto Thee will I set my face
And worship Thee in humbleness

Let those who have their trust in Thee
With great acclaim declare their joy
Let those whom Thou keepest rejoice
Ev'n those who love Thy holy name.

Unto the righteous, God didst stretch
His hands to scatter blessings free
Thy favour shall Thy people own
As their great child shield and protection.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
4.6.4.6.6.6.4.
And the Lord went before them. Exd.13:21

Give me a gentle heart
Fill'd with meekness,
Diligent heart like Thine
Jesus, my Lord
Humbleness and patience
A heart of compassion
In every small detail
To be like Him.

Give me contentment in
All conditions
Be it e'en humbler than
His lowly birth
Give me Thou Thy comfort
Give me also Thy help
In every small detail
To be like Him.

Give me Enthusiasm
In things of Thine
Earnestness and more love
For things of heav'n
Give me a holy heart
Give me hatred for sin
In every small detail
To be like Him.

Give me a heart of faith
A hope in Thee
Give joy of salvation
In Jesus Christ
Give me a living soul
Give a crown of glory
And when I shall awake
To be like Him.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.6.6.8.8.
I will sing praise to my God.Ps.104:33

Upon what was planted
Send Thy dew of blessing
For Thine is the power
That makes the crops to grow
Let the harvest be abundant
The praises will be Thine alone.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
And ye shall seek me and find me when ye shall search for me with all your heart.Jer.29:13

Jesus, Lord we come Thee,
At Thy feet we humbly kneel,
Despise not our petition
Ah! Shall we seek Thee in vain?

In the way you choose for us,
We are seeking Thee this hour,
O Lord, we shall not depart,
Until Thou will bless us all.

Send a message in Thy word
That gives joy unto our hearts
May Thy spirit here bestow
Forgiveness to all our hearts.

Let us see Thee and find Thee
As a benevolent God
Heal the sick, set captives free,
Let us all rejoice in Thee.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: My blessed Redeemer
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
My blessed Redeemer
Rescue me from this sleep
Do, tell me now, wake up, wake up
Jesus shall make thee whole.

Do, lay Thy hands on me
And wake me now from sleep
Give me the understanding Lord,
Thy might, Thy pow'r how great!

Let me cry unto Thee
And let me be watchful
Lest I fall into temptation
And thereby loose my shield.

Now, let me be prepared
Against the foe's attack
For ever to stand uprightly
And to look unto Thee.

di	Thou seest my weakness, Lord
Jesus, my strength Thou art,
My helper in adversity
My refuge and my shield

Lord, let me trust in Thee,
Be Thou my dwelling place;
Thou art my shield and my buckler
And Thou art my Saviour.

I cannot save myself
Nor can I keep myself,
My strength doth come Lord from Thine hand
O Thou who slumbers not.

To Thee, and Thee alone
I my life doth commend,
Jesus, love me just as Thine own
And love me to the end.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 13.12.12.&Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
13.12.12.&Ref.
For I am the Lord that healeth thee.Exd.15:26

Hear the footsteps of Jesus, He is now passing by,
Bearing balm for the wounded, healing all who apply;
As He spake to the suff'rer who lay at the pool,
He is saying this moment "wilt thou be made whole?"
Wilt thou be made whole,
Wilt thou be made whole,
Oh, come weary sufferer,
Oh, come, sin-sick soul;
See the life-stream is flowing
See the cleansing waves roll;
Step into the current and thou shalt be whole.

'Tis the voice of that Saviour whose merciful call,
Freely offers salvation to one and to all,
He is now beckoning to Him, each sin tainted soul,
And loving asking wilt thou be made whole.

Are you halting and struggling, o'er powered by your sin,
While the waters are troubled, can you not enter in?
Lo, the Saviour stands waiting to strengthen your soul,
He is earnestly pleading, "wilt thou be made whole?"

Blessed Saviour, assist us, to rest on Thy word,
Let the soul healing power, on us now be outpoured:
Wash away every sin spot, take perfect control
Say to each trusting spirit, "wilt thou be made whole?"

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Jesus, Thou the great Physician
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Jesus, Thou the great Physician
The sick in distress come to Thee;
In time of sickness and great pains
He healed them all of their sickness.

The blind, the lame and the infirm
They all received Thy tender care,
For this reason, we come to Thee
We plead for Thy mercy alone.

The awful pains that Thou went through
Jesus, Thou canst heal these also,
Who look to the great physician
We beseech Thee, to heal them all.

Lord Jesus, grant that affliction
May draw the sick nearer to Thee
May the scourge with which you afflict
Bring back the backslider to Thee.

Heal the broken and contrite heart,
O Lord save Thou our sinful heart,
Heal us and grant abundant health
So we may praise thee ever more.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
But when He saw the multitudes He was moved with compassion on them.Matt.9:36

When the Saviour dwelt below,
Pity in His bosom reigned;
Sympathy He loved to show,
Nor the meanest suit disdained.

Round Him throng'd the blind, the lame
Deaf and dumb, diseas'd, posess'd
None in vain for healing came,
All the Saviour freely bless'd.

List'ning sinners round Him pressed
Whilst He taught the way to bliss;
Even enemies confess'd,
"No man ever spake like this."

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 6.10.6. &. Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.10.6. &. Ref.
For she said within herself, if I may but torch His garment shall be well.Matt.9:21

She only touched the helm of His garment
As to His side she stole
Amid the crowd that gathered around Him
And straight way she was whole.
Oh, touch the helm of His garment
And thou, too shalt be free
His saving power this very hour
Shall give new life to thee.

She came in fear and trembling before Him
She knew her Lord had come
She felt that from him virtue had healed her
The mighty deed was done.

He turned with, Daughter be of good comfort
Thy faith hath made thee whole
And peace that passeth all understanding
With gladness filled her soul.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Thine arm, O Lord, in days of old,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Thine arm, O Lord, in days of old,
Was strong to heal and save;
It triumph'd o'er disease and death,
O'er darkness and the grave.
To Thee they went-the blind, the dumb,
The palsied, and the lame,
The leper with his tainted life,
The sick with fever'd frame.

And lo! Thy touch brought life and health,
Gave speech, and strength, and sight;
Own'd Thee, the Lord, be near to bless,
Almighty as of yore,
In crowded street, by restless couch,
As by Gennesaret's shore.

Be Thou our great Deliverer still,
Thou Lord of life and death;
Restore and quicken, soothe and bless,
With Thine almighty breath;
To hands that work and eyes that see
Give wisdom's heav'nly lore,
That whole and sick, and weak and strong,
May praise Thee evermore.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.8.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.D.
Jesus Christ, the same yesterday and today and forever.Heb.13:8

Jesus is the same for ever,
As of so now today;
All the hosts of hell endeavour
Vainly to obstruct His ways,
In His peoples hearts He reigneth,
Finishes what He begins;
Jesus still' all power' retaineth.
Saves His people from their sins.

Jesus is the same for ever,
Yes, He heals the sick to-day
As of old, so now, He never
Turns one suffering child away.
He can cure the worst diseases
For He understands our frame;
Bore our grief's, and so releases
All who dare their rights too claim.

Jesus is the same for ever,
Still He says 'In me abide'
From His love no pow'r can sever
Those who in their Lord confide
Sweetly from all care He free us,
Ours the comfort- His the shame,
Blessed Saviour; precious Jesus
There's no music like Thy name.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Command Thy healing Jesus Christ
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Command Thy healing Jesus Christ
Which is as same today
O let the power of Thy name
Heal me, and make me whole,

If Thou art still a friend O Lord
Unto the needy ones
Perform Thy wondrous work on me
That l may praise Thy name.

I call upon Thee Lord today
Perform Thy miracle
As leper look Thou upon  me
That kneel down at Thy feet.

My ears are deaf unto Thy laws
Open m ears O Lord
Command and make my wither'd hand
To lift it up to Thee.

Like that lame man at Bethsida
Let me receive Thy strength
Then I will jump to praise like pant
I will jump

I am blind from my mother's womb
My soul is very dark
I cannot see the love of God
The sins' worth, I can't know.

I heart that Thou art passing by
Come nearer unto me
O Jesus, Thou Son of David
In mercy, hear my cry.

Behold, I'm waiting at thy path
O Thou the light of heav'n
Command, and say thou unto me
Sinner receive thy sight.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: O Thou, whom once they flocked to hear,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
O Thou, whom once they flocked to hear,
Thy words hear, Thy pow'r to feel
Suffer the sinners to draw near,
And graciously receive us still,

They that be whole, Thyself hast said,
No need of a physician have;
But I am sick, and want Thine aid,
And want Thine utmost pow'r to save

Thy pow'r and truth, and love divine,
The same from age to age endure;
A word, a gracious word of Thine
The most inveterate plague can cure.

Helpless howe'ermy spirit lies,
And long hath languish's at the pool
A word of Thine shall make me rise,
And speak me in a moment whole.

Eighteen, or eight-and thirty, years,
Or thousands, are alike to Thee
Soon as Thy saving grace appears,
My plague is gone, my heart is free.

Make this the acceptable hour;
Come, O my soul's Physician, Thou!
Display Thy sanctifying pow'r
And show me Thy salvation now.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: O Lord my God, on Thee I'll call
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
O Lord my God, on Thee I'll call
I am in pains, O hear my cry;
When floods of water cover me
Forbid that my heart should backside.

Thou Lord art friend of the infirm
To whom shall I make my complaint?
If not to Thee, and only Thee,
Who calls the miserable to Him

Who has e'er wept to Thee in vain?
Has Thou e'er shunned anyone's cry?
Art Thou not the One who promis'd
Who calls the miserable to Him

This could have been my heart' sorrow
That Thou Lord does not answer pray'r
But Thou has been answ'ring my pray'rs
O Lord, Thou has been my helper.

I know I ma needy and poor
But Thou God will not forget me
He, for whom Jesus is pleading
Is set free from all his troubles.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
O Lord, rebuke me not in Thine anger. S. 6:1

O Almighty, used Thy rod
To touch thou my head gently,
Make Thou Thine anger to cease,
Let me fall under it

Heal Thou my infinity
Look on me, I seek Thy grace,
This alone, my only plea
Look on me in Thy mercy

Who is it, deep in the grave
Who can talk of deliverance?
O Lord, sustain Thou my soul,
Utter Thy voice, I will live

Look! He comes He heard my pleas,
Here He comes, and shadows flee!
What glory surrounds me now!
O my souls, arise, and sing.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Jesus Lord, we look to Thee
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Jesus Lord, we look to Thee
For the healing of the sick
Thou has shown Thy-great mercy
To the sick man near the lake

There's no physician like Thee
That can heal soul and body,
Thou didst raise Jairu's daughter
And brought her forth from the dead

Lazarus was sick before,
Died, was buried in the grave,
But Thou the Great Physician
Rais'd the dead on the fourth day.

Jesus, Lord pardon our sins,
Help us heal this sickness, Lord,
That he stand, to Thy glory
So, we may give praise to Thee

Thou has never, failed to heal
And sickness, while on earth,
Thou has said in Thy mercy
That Thy promise will not fail.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: I put my trust in Thee
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
I put my trust in Thee
As I lay on my bed,
Deliver me from great pains
Come Thou and make me whole

For there is no other
In whom I put my trust,
Thou heal'd Peter's mother-in-law
From her fev'rish illness

The woman, long ago,
With her issue of blood
By touching the hem of Thy role
She receiv'd Thy healing

Heal me, O Saviour, Lord
Raise me from my illness,
I should not fear any sickness
When my trust is in Thee.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Thy work, Almighty God
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Thy work, Almighty God
Is still unsearchable
All things work together for good
Of them that do Thy will

You see my illness, Lord
My sickness and sufferings
The pains I bear both day and night
No sleep would come to me

Consider my troubles
O, Thou great physician
Tell me, like king Hezekiah
I, God, have heard Thy pray'rs

Behold all my helpers
And my physician too
Tell me like King Hezekiah
That I have seen thy tears

See not my shortcomings
Forgive me all my sins
Heal me like King Hezekiah
Add more days to my life.

Make me useful for Thee
After this my illness
And if any work on earth is done
Take me to glory land.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
be of good cheer, thy sins be forgiven thee.  Matt. 9:2

Jesus when Thou were on earth
You ceas'd not to heal the sick,
The cry of the suffering sick
Did never fall to the ground

Thou art too compassionate
To leave sinners to suffer,
di	Though the affliction is meet,
For him, for his sinfulness.

In the fight that I might be
Free from all eternal doom,
You made provision for me
That I have peace in my flesh

Visit the sick of Thy flock
Rent with pain on his sick bed
The true and great physician
Heal the sick and make him whole

Grant him abundant comfort,
May he put his trust in Thee,
May he know that Thou alone
Thou can kill for or make alive

Grant him grace never to doubt,
Nor when in pain to give up,
Give him Thy grace to affirm,
"In life or death, it's Thy will",

We implore Thou Lord to heal,
All the sick one in Thy flock;
If Thou wilt not, then we know
All things work our for our good.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: The one who made the blind to see
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
The one who made the blind to see
And made wise the simple
And He who created the light
For all those in darkness

The One who can give strength and death
To the infirm and sick
And he who can bring back to life
The ones who were once dead.

The One who bestow'd deliverance
And raised him that did all
And changed the sorrow of today
To songs and Psalms of praise.

Thou great physician of my soul
To Thee we raise our song;
For ever more, world without end
Thine e'er will be the praise.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 12.11.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
12.11.&.Ref.
They who seek the Lord shall not lack any good thing. Ps. 34:10

In some way or other the
Lord will provide
It may not be my way,
It may not be thy way
And yet, in His own way, the
Lord will provide
Then we'll trust in the Lord, and
He will provide,
Yes, we'll trust in the Lord, and
He will trust in the Lord, and
He will provide

At some time or other,
The Lord will provide,
It may be my time,
It may be my time,
And yet, in His own time,
The Lord will provide

Despond then no longer,
The Lord will provide,
And this be the token,
No word He hath spoken
Was ever yet broken,
The Lord will provide

March on then right boldly,
The sea shall divide,
The pathway, made glorious
With shouting victorious
We'll join in the chorus,
The Lord will provide

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
4.8.4.8.8.8.4.
Is it well with thee.  It is well. II Kings 4:26

Though we pass through tribulation,
All, will be well:
Christ hath purchase'd full salvation
All, al is well:
Happy still in God, confiding;
Fruitful, if in Christ abiding,
Holy, through the Spirit's guiding
All, must be well:

We except a bright tomorrow;
All, will be well:
Faith can sing through days of sorrow,
All, all is well:
On our Father's love relying
Jesus every need supplying
di	Then in living or in dying
All, must be well:

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 8.8. D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8. D.
For it was founded upon a rock. Matt. 7:25.

My hope is built on nothing else
Than Jesus' blood and righteousness;
di	No merit of my own I claim
But wholly lean on Jesus name
On Christ the solid rock I stand
All other ground is sinking sand

When darkness seems to veil His face
I rest on His unchanging grace
In every high and stormy gale
My anchor holds within the veil
On Christ the solid rock I stand
All other ground is sinking sand

His Oath, His covenant and blood
Support me in the whelming flood
di	When all around my soul gives way
He then is all my hope and stay
On Christ the solid rock I stand
All other ground is sinking sand

When the last trumpet's voice shall sound
O may I then in Him be found
Robed in His righteousness alone,
Faultless to stand before the throne,
On Christ the solid rock I stand
All other ground is sinking sand.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Oh, for a faith that will not shrink
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Oh, for a faith that will not shrink
Though pressed by many foes
That will tremble on the brink
Of poverty of woe.

That will not murmur not complain
Beneath the chast'ning rod,
But, in the hour of grief pain,
Can lean upon its God.

A faith that shines more bright and clear
When tempests rage without,
That when in danger knows no fear,
In darkness feel on doubt.

A faith that keeps the narrow way
Till life's last spark is fled,
And with a pure and heav'nly ray
Lights up a dying bed.

Lord, give me such a faith as this,
And then, whate'er army come,
I taste e'en now the hallow'd bliss
Of an Eternal Home.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.7.7.6.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.6.&.Ref.
For by grace are ye saved.  Eph. 2:8

Weeping will not save me!
Though my face were bathed in tears
That could not allay my fears
Could not wash the sins of years
Weeping will not save me!

Weeping will not save me!
Purest deeds that I can do
Holiest thoughts and feelings too
Cannot form my soul anew
Working will not save mw!

Weeping will not save me!
Helpless, guilty, lost, I lie
In my ear is Mercy's cry
If I wait I can but die
Waiting will not save me!

Weeping will not save me!
Let me trust Thy weeping Son
Trust the work that He has done
To His arms, Lord, help me run
Faith in Christ will save me!.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 8.8.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.D.
Blessed are they that have not seen and yet have believed. Joh. 20:29

We saw Thee not when Thou didst come
To this poor world of sin and death
Nor e'er beheld Thy cottage home
In that despised Nazareth,
But we believe Thy footsteps trod
Its streets and plains, Thou Son of God.

We did not see Thee lifted high
Amid that wild and savage crew,
Nor heard Thy meek, imploring cry,
Forgive, They know not what they do!
yet we believe the deed was done,
Which shook the earth and veiled the sun.

We stood not by the empty tomb,
Where late Thy sacred body lay,
Nor sat within that upper room,
Nor met Thee in the open way
But we believe that angels said:
Why seek the living with the dead?

We did not mark the chosen few,
When Thou didst through the clouds ascend
First lift to heav'n their wondering view,
Then to the earth all prostrate bend;
Yet we believe that mortal eyes
Behold that journey to the skies

And Now that Thou dost reign on high
And thence Thy waiting people bless,
di	No ray of glory form the sky
Doth shine upon our wilderness,
But we believer Thy faithful word,
And trust in our Redeeming Lord.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Faith is the ladder that connects
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Faith is the ladder that connects
The heaven and the earth,
Through faith, the many miracles
Were wrought on earth by Christ.

Enoch rode chariot of fire
By which he went to heav'n,
It saved the three Hebrew children
And Daniel from the den.

By faith Noah prepared an Ark
The ark of salvation;
The pow'r that took Elijah up
In chariot of fire.

Faith is the foundation of hope
It can perform great things,
Faith brings something out of nothing,
Can do the impossible.

By faith, God spoke the Word of pow'r:
And lo, the world was made!
By the same pow'r of faith, at last
The sinner shall be sav'd.

"Be it unto you as your faith"
The Saviour always said:
Give me a heart that will believe
Thy words of promise, Lord.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: In all ways chosen by the Lord
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
In all ways chosen by the Lord
My journey will I go
Prevent me not ye holy men,
I will follow thee there.

If Jesus moves in the furnace
I will follow Him there
Prevent me not will be my word
If the world oppose me.

In adoration, temptation
With Thy Command I'll go
Prevent me not, for I will go
Unto Emmanuel.

And when my Saviour shall call me
And still my cry shall be
Prevent me not, death is coming
I will follow with joy.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 11.11.11. & Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
11.11.11. & Ref.
Neither give place to the devil. Eph.4:27.

Yield not to temptation, for yielding is sin
Each victory will help you some other to win
Fight manfully onward, dark passions subdue,
Look ever to Jesus, He'll carry you through,
Ask, the Saviour to help you,
Comfort, strengthen and keep you.
He is willing to aid you,
He will carry you through.

Shun evil companions, bad language disdain
God's name hold in reverence, nor take it in vain,
Be thoughtful and earnest, kind hearted and true,
Look ever to Jesus, He'll carry you through.

To him that o'er cometh, God giveth a crown.
Through faith we shall conquer, though often cast down,
He who is our Saviour, our strength will renew
Look ever to Jesus, He'll carry you through.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: O for a faith that not shrink
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
O for a faith that not shrink
Tho' press'd by ev'ry foe
But in the hour of grief or pain
Will lean upon its God.

This is incomprehensible
Yet will I fear no foe
With God all things are possible
His words shall never fail.

Lord, give us such a faith as this
That faith that never fails
A faith that keeps the narrow way
Till life's last speak is fled.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.5.
Ask and it shall be given you. Matt. 7:7.

He will answer every pray'r
This, His promise and His will
He has never chang'd nor fail'd
Glory to His name.

He will answer every pray'r
To His promise I will cling
I know He'll ne'er deceive me,
Glory to His name.

He will answer every pray'r
Let us ask from Him in faith
With his Holy Spirit's help
Glory to His name.

He will answer every pray'r
Come thou to the mercy seat
Blest assurance you'll receive
Glory to His name.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.8.7.
The Lord is my shepherd. Ps.23: 1.

Jesus Saviour is my Shepherd
Then, fear and distrust remove
From the lion and the wild bear
And from wild and evil beasts
Jesus will guard his lonely sheep
Jesus will care for His own.

Satan nearly o'er power'd me
Jesus said, "this is my sheep"
He died in order to save me
Jesus, what great love is this?
With Jesus, victory is sure
There's nought Him can overcome.

He leads me in the way of Life,
Near the gently flowing stream;
He makes me rest in green pastures
Where pois'nous weeds do not grow,
There I hear the voice of Jesus
There He makes my heart rejoice.

When I walk the valley of death
And there's fear along my way
I shall not fear any evil,
For my shepherd is so hear
His rod and staff they comfort me
For they make His sheep rejoice.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: It is not meet for Saints to fear
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
It is not meet for Saints to fear
Nor for them to despair,
For when they least expect His help;
The Saviour will appear.

When Abraham took up his knife
God's voice said to him, "stop"
The yonder ram caught by the horn
Shall substitute thy son.

When Jonah sank beneath the waves
No hope of escape near
God sent a fish that swallowed him
And brought him to the shore.

With such great might and loves as this
Abounding in His word;
I pray to bring my anxious cares
And leave them all to Him.

Lift up your eyes and wait His help
It may be long but wait;
Though the promise may tarry long,
It soon shall come to pass.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 8.8.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.D.
For the zeal of Thy house hath eaten me up. Ps. 69:9

I want even strong desire,
I want a calmly fervent zeal
To have poor souls out of the fire,
To snatch them from the verge of hell
And turn them to a pardoning God,
And quench the brands in Jesus' blood.

I would the precious time redeem,
And longer live for this alone,
To spend, and to be spend, for them
Who have not yet my Saviour known;
Fully on these my mission prove,
And only breathe, to breathe Thy love.

Enlarge, inflame, and fill my heart
With boundless charity divine!
So shall I all my strength exert,
And love them with a zeal like Thine;
And lead them to Thy open side,
The sheep for whom their Shepherd died.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: There's a glorious work before us,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
There's a glorious work before us,
A work both great and grand;
Every man at once should join us,
And help with heart and hand.

There are homes now full of sadness,
Whence peace and love are flown;
We must fill these homes with gladness,
And make the Saviour known.

There are drink bond slaves around us,
Who writhe in helpless woe;
We must snap the bonds that bind them,
And lay the tyrant low.

There are wives and mothers weeping,
Whose hearts are cold and sad;
We must give them joyous greeting,
And bid them yet be glad.

There are crowds of little children,
Deep sunk in sin and night;
We must rise them from their darkness,
And lead them up to light.

Let us then grid on our armour,
`	And God our strength shall be;
He the hosts is onward leading
To certain victory!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
Let brotherly continue. Heb. 13:1

Jesus, Lord, we look to Thee,
Let us in Thy name agree,
Show Thyself the Prince of Peace,
Bid our strife for ever cease

By Thy reconciling love
Every stumbling-block remove,
Each to each unite, endear,
Come, and spread Thy banner here

Make us of one heart and mind,
Courteous, pitiful, and kind,
Lowly, meek, in thought and word,
Altogether like our Lord

Let us for each other care,
Each the other's burden bear,
To Thy church the pattern give,
Show how true believers live.

Free from anger and from pride,
Let us thus in God abide,
All the depths of love express,
All the heights of holiness.

Let us then with joy remove
To the family above;
On the wings of angels fly,
Show how true believers die.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Blest be the dear uniting love,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Blest be the dear uniting love,
That will not let us part;
Our bodies may far off remove,
We still are one in heart,

Joined in one spirit to our Head,
Where He appoints we go,
And still in Jesus footsteps tread,
And show His praise below

O may we ever walk in Him,
And nothing know beside,
Nothing desire, nothing esteem,
But Jesus crucified

Closer and closer let us cleave
To His beloved embrace
Expect His fullness to receive,
And grace to answer grace.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Behold how pleasant for brethren
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Behold how pleasant for brethren
To dwell in unity,
Brethren whose hearts are in oneness
In Holy fellowship.

It is like the precious ointment
That ran down Aaron's bread
And on it went down to his skirts
And brought forth sweet perfume

For it is pleasant as the dew
That descends on Zion;
Where God reveals His great glory,
And shows to us His grace.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: Happy that heart where graces, reign,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
Happy that heart where graces, reign,
Where love inspires the breast,
Love is the brightest
And perfects all the rest.

Knowledge, alas! 'tis all in vain,
And all in vain our fear,
Our stubborn sins will fight and reign,
If love be absent there

This is the grace that lives and sings
When faith and hope shall cease,
'Tis this shall strike our joyful strings
In the sweet realm of bliss,

Before we quite forsake our clay,
Or leave this dark abode,
The wings of love bear us away
To see our gracious God
Amen.
464
S.M.
And the multitude of those that believed were of one heart. Act. 4:32

Blest be the tie that binds
Our hearts in Christian love
The fellowship of kindred minds
Is like to that above.

Before our Father's throne,
We pour our ardent pray'rs;
Our fears, our hopes, our aims are one
Our comforts and our cares

When we asunder part,
It gives us inward pain;
But we shall still be joined in heart,
And hope to meet again,

This glorious hope revives
Our courage by the way,
While each in expectation lives,
And longs to see the day

From sorrow, toil and pain,
And sin we shall be free;
And perfect love and friendship reign
Through all eternity.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: All praise to our redeeming Lord,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
All praise to our redeeming Lord,
Who joins us by His grace,
And bids us, each to each restored,
Together seek His face,

He bids us build each other up;
And, gathered into one,
To our high calling's glorious hope
We hand in hand go on.

The gift which He on one bestows,
We all delight to prove,
The grace through every vessel flows,
In purest streams of love

Ev'n now we think and speak the same,
And cordially agree;
Concentrated all, through Jesus' name,
In perfect harmony

We all partake the joy of one,
The common peace we feel,
A peace to sensual minds unknown,
A joy unspeakable

And if our fellowship below
In Jesus be so sweet,
What heights of rapture shall we know
When round His throne we meet!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 8.8.8.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.8.D.
Behold how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity. Ps. 133:1

How good and pleasant 'tis to see,
When brethren cordially agree,
And kindly think and speak the same!
A family of faith and love,
Combin'd to seek the things above,
And spread the common Saviour's fame.

The God of grace, who all invites
Who in our unity delights,
Vouchsafes our intercourse to bless;
Revives us with refreshing show'rs
The fullness of His blessing pours,
And keeps our minds in perfect peace.

Jesus, Thou precious corner-stone,
Preserve inseparably one
Whom Thou didst by Thy Spirit join;
Still let us in Thy Spirit live,
And to Thy church the pattern give
Of unanimity divine.

Still let us to each other cleave,
And from Thy plentitude receive
Constant supplied of hallowing grace,
Till to a perfect man we rise,
O'er take our kindred in the skies,
And find prepar'd our heav'nly place.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.6.6.8.8.
Behold how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity. PS. 133:1

Behold, who good a thing
It is to dwell in peace,
How pleasing to our King
This fruit of righteousness;
When brethren all in one agree,
Who knows the joys of unity

Where unity is found,
The sweet anointing grace
Extends to all around,
And consecrates the place,
To every waiting soul it comes,
And fills it with divine perfumes.

Grace every morning new,
And every night, we feel,
The soft, refreshing dew
That falls on Hermon's hill!
On Zion it doth sweetly fall;
The grace of one descends on all.

Ev'n now our Lord doth pour
The blessing form above,
A kindly, gracious show'r
Of heart reviving love
The former and the later rain,
The love of God and love of man

In Him when brethren join,
And follow after peace,
The fellowship divine
He promises to bless;
His choicest graces to bestow
Where too or three are met below.

The riches of His grace
In fellowship are giv'n
To Zion's chosen race,
The citizens of heav'n
He fills them with His choicest store,
He give them life for evermore.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
O come, let us sing unto the Lord,

Come, and let us sweetly join
Christ to praise in hymns divine,
Give we all, with on accord,
Glory to our common Lord

Hands, and hearts, and voices raise,
Sing as in the ancient days;
Antedate the joys above,
Celebrate the feast of love.

Strive we, in affection strive;
Let the purer flame revive
Such as in the martys glowed,
Dying champions for their God.

We, like them, may live and love;
Called we are their joy to prove,
Sav'd with them from future wrath,
Partners of like precious faith.

Sing we then in Jesus' name,
Now as yesterday the same,
One in every time and place,
Full for all of truth and grace.

We for Christ, our Master, stand
Lights in a benighted land;
We our dying Lord confess,
We are Jesus' witnesses.

Witnesses that Christ hath died,
We with Him are crucified
Christ hath burst the bands of death
We His quick'ning Spirit breathe

Christ is now gone up on high,
Thither all our wishes fly,
Sits at God's right hand above,
There with Him we reign in love.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.7.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.&.Ref.
Thou are my portion. Ps. 119:57.

Christ is my portion for ever,
He is my Saviour from sin;
He is my blessed salvation,
I have the witness within.
I have the witness within...
Jesus now saves me from sin....
In His hear I've a place,
I am saved by His grace
And I have the witness within

He is my fortress and tower,
He is my guide and my King;
He is my Shepherd, my Keeper
Joyfully now I can sing.

Praise to the One who redeems me,
Praise to my Crucified Lord,
Now I am saved, Hallelujah,
Praise for the wonderful word

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
10.8.8.15.10.
For all our days are passed away in Thy wrath,
we spend our years as a tale that is told. Ps. 90:9

The days that glide so swiftly down
The highway of the past
Are filled with many weary hour of pain;
But the love of God grows stronger,
As the waiting hour seems longer,
Ad though silent be my voice, my
Longing heart repeat the strain
Nearer, my God to Thee,
Nearer to Thee

Each moment brings me nearer to
the time when I must leave
The scenes of earth that seem to dear to me
Bu the sight of home is clear,
And my hope of heaven dearer,
Than the world and all its glory, and
Its wealth could ever be.

So let ransomed of the Lord
repeat the song of trust,
And lean the harder on the word of God
On it promises abiding
As a refuge 'neath it hiding,
Travel bravely on the highway that
the saints and martyrs trod.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 4.7.4.6.6.6.4.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
4.7.4.6.6.6.4.&.Ref.
Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness. II. Tim. 4:8.

I shall wear a golden crown
When I get home
I shall lay my burdens down
Clad in robes of glory
I shall sing the story of the
Lord who bought me
When I get home
When I get home
When I get home
All sorrow will be over
When I get home
When I get home
When I get home
All sorrow will be over
When I get home

All the darkness will be past
When I get home
I shall se the light at last
When I get home
Light from heaven streaming
O'er my pathway beaming
Ever guides me onward
Till I get home.

I shall see my Saviour's face
When I get home
Sing again of saving grace
When I get home
I shall stand before him
Gladly I'll adore Him
Ever to be with Him
When I get home

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: The sound of joy of good tidings
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
The sound of joy of good tidings
Christ shall be shown in me
And I will see my Saviour's face
I will be make known here.

My soul shall be His dwelling place
I hear His spirit's voice
Saying, behold I come quickly
My Lord will never fail.

The glorious Crown of righteousness
That I'm looking ahead
When In His might I'm victorious
I'll grasp and wear the crown.

With joy I look the promised land
From the mount of Pisga
My expectation will not fail
I have a glorious hope,

He visits my body of clay
His dwelling place to clear
O that Christ may come on this day
Into His dwelling place.

I know my Saviour lives with me
But this is yet to be
Unless I'm blessed with Paradise
And in my heart to dwell.

O Lord show Thy self unto me
And fill Thou all these gaps
Only Thou Lord can fill my soul
Come Thou O Lord, my God.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 4.6.7.7.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
4.6.7.7.&.Ref.
Be ye also patient for the coming of the Lord draweth near. Jam. 5:8

Jesus may come today
Glad day, glad day!
And I would see my Friend
Dangers and troubles would end
If Jesus should come today
Glad day, glad day!
Is it the crowning day?
I'll live for today, nor anxious be
Jesus my Lord I soon shall see
Glad day, glad day!
Is the crowning day?

I may go home today
Glad day, glad day!
Seemeth I hear their song
Hail to the radiant throng
If I should go home today,

Why should anxious be?
Glad day, glad day!
Lights appear on the shore
Storms will affright nevermore
For He is "at hand" today.

Faithful I'll be today
Glad day, glad day!
And I will freely tell
Why I should love Him so well
For He is my all today.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.8.8.8.
They rejoice before Thee according to the joy in harvest. Isa. 9:3

Lord of the harvest, Thee we hail,
Thine ancient promise doth not fail,
The varying seasons haste their round
With goodness all our years are crow'd
Our thanks we pay This holy day,
Oh let our hearts in tune be found.

If spring doth wake the song of mirth,
If summer warms the fruitful earth,
When winter sweeps the naked plain,
Or autumn yields ripen'd grain,
Still do we sing to Thee, our King;
Through all their changes Thou dost reign.

But chiefly, when Thy liberal hand
Scattered new plenty o'er the land,
When sounds of music fill the air,
As homeward all their treasures bear;
We too will raise our hymn of praise,
For we Thy common bounties share.

Lord of the harvest, all is Thine,
The rains that fall, the suns that shine
The seed once hidden in the ground,
The skill that makes our fruits abound,
New every year Thy gifts appears.
New praises from our lips shall sound.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.7.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.D.
He that goeth forth and weapeth bearing precious seed, shall doubtless come again
with rejoicing bringing his sheaves with him. Ps. 126:6.

Come, ye thankful people, come,
Raise the song of harvest home:
All is safely garther in,
Ere the winter storms begin;
God our Maker doth provide
For our wants to be supplied:
Come to God's own temple, come,
Raise the song of harvest home!.

We ourselves are God's own field,
Fruit unto His praise to yield;
Wheat and tares together sown,
Unto joy or sorrow grown;
First the blade, and then the ear,
Then the full corn shall appear:
Grant, O harvest Lord, that we
Wholesome grain and pure may be.

For the Lord our God shall come,
And shall take His harvest home,
From His field shall in that day
All offences purge away;
Give His angles charge at last
In the five the tares to cast;
But the fruitful ears to store
In His garner evermore.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.8.7.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.&.Ref.
There shall be showers of blessing. Ezek. 34:26

"There shall be showers of blessing",
This is the promise of love;
There shall be seasons refreshing,
Sent from the Saviour above
Showers of blessing
Showers of blessing we need,
Mercy drops round us are failing
But for the showers of blessing

"There shall be showers of blessing
Precious reviving again,
Over the hills and the valleys
Sound of abundance of rain,

"There shall be showers of blessing
Sent them upon us, O Lord!
Grant to us now a refreshing
Come, and now honour Thy word.

"There shall be showers of blessing
Oh that today they might fall,
Now as to God we'er confessing
Now as on Jesus we call.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 6.7.6.D.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.7.6.D.&.Ref.
While the earth reamineth, seedtime and harvest shall not cease. Gen. 8:22

We plough the fields, and scatter
The good seed on the land,
But it is fed and watered
By God's almighty hand;
He sends the snow in winter,
The warmth to smell the grain,
The breezes, and the sunshine,
And soft refreshing rain.
All good gifts around us
Are sent from heaven above,
Then thank the Lord,
O thank the Lord,
For all His love.

He only is the Maker
Of al things near and far;
He paints the wayside flower,
He lights the evening star;
The winds and waves obey Him,
By Him the birds are fed,
Much more to us, His children,
He gives our daily bread.

We thank Thee then, O Father,
For all things bright and good,
The seed-time and the harvest,
Our live, our health, our food;
Accept all Thy love imparts,
And, what Thou most desirest,
Our humble, thankful hearts.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 6.7.6. Triple
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.7.6. Triple
Behold a sower went forth to sow. Matt. 13:3

The sower went forth sowing,
The seed in secret slept
Through days of faith and patience,
Till out the green blade crept,
And warmed by golden sunshine,
And fed by silver rain,
At last the fields were whitened
To harvest once again
O praise the heav'nly Sower
Who gave the fruitful seed,
And watch'd and water'd duly,
And ripend'd for our need.

Behold! the heav'nly Sower
Goes forth with better seed,
The word of sure salvation,
With feet and hands that bleed,
Here is His church 'tis scattered,
Our spirits are the soil;
Then let an ample fruitage
Repay His pain and toil
O beautiful the harvest
Wherein all goodness thrives,
And this the true thanksgiving,
The first-first of our lives

Within a hallowed acre
He sows yet other grain,
When peaceful earth receive
The dead He died to gain,
For, though the growth be hidden
We know that they shall rise,
Yea, even now they ripen
Yea, even now they white
In sunny paradise.
O summer land of white
O fields for ever white
With souls that wear Christ's raiment
With crowns of golden light!

One day the heav'nly Sower
Shall reap where he hath sown,
And come again rejoicing
And with Him bring His own;
Shall winnow from His floor
Th chaff into the floor
That flameth evermore,
O holy, awful Reaper,
Have mercy in the day
Thou puttest in Thy sickle,
And cast us not away.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.8.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.D.
I have not cancelled thy loving kindness ad thy truth from the great congregation.
Ps. 40:10

To Thee, O Lord, our hearts we raise
In hymns of adoration,
To Thee bring sacrifice of praise
With shouts of exultation;
Bright robes of gold the fields adorn,
The hills with joy are ringing,
The valleys stand so thick with corn
That even they are singing.

And now, on this our festal day;
Thy bounteous hand confessing,
Before Thee thankfully we lay
The first-fruit of Thy blessing
By Thee the souls of men are fed
With gifts of grace supernal;
Thou who dost give us earthly bread,
Give us the bread eternal.

We bear the burden of the day,
And often toil seems dreary;
But labour ends with sunset ray,
And rest comes for the weary,
May we, the angel-reaping o'er
Stand at the last accepted
Christ's golden sheaves for evermore
Of garners bright elected.

O blessed is that land of God
Where saints abide, for ever,
Where golden fields spread far and broad
Where flows the crystal river.
The strains of all its holy throng
With ours to-day are blending;
Thrice blessed is that harvest song
Which never hath an ending.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
5.6.5.
And this day shall be unto you far a memorial and ye shall
keep it a feast to the Lord. Exod. 12:14

All thanks O Lord to Thee
For this occasion
Of the anniversary
Glory to Thy name
With the song of praises
We'll worship with joy
For blessing for our lives
And the hope of heav'n
Rejoice ye, now rejoice
Shout Hallelujah!
We bring offering to Thee
Accept our offerings.

Most of our companions
Have now pass'd away
Many have backslides
Away from the Lord
All thanks to Thee O Lord
That our lives are spared
For this anniversary
We are made worthy.

Our heav'nly Father
We have decided
To serve Thee our Saviour
All days of our lives
We shall work for the growth
Until Thou shall call us
To Thy heav'nly rest.

O Thou Lord of harvest
We give thanks to Thee
di	Let Thy blessing O Lord
Go round upon us
We beseech Thee O God
That Thou give us strength
To serve Thee to the end
Of our days on earth.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 6.6.6.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.6.6.D.
Thy saints shall bless thee. Ps. 145:10

Glory praise and honour
Unto Jesus our Lord
For keeping us alive
Our hearts are fill'd with joy
For His great privilege
And to labour for Thee
In Thy vineyard on earth.

We thank Thee for guidance
And the pow'r of Spirit
And the gift of great love
That binds us together
O Jesus, our Shepherd
Accept our praises now
For Thy Compassion sake
Unite us for ever.

Bless us heav'nly Father
On this our harvest day
Send Thy sign unto us
To have joy in Thy praise
Let us be successful
Lord in our daily task
Let's put our trust in Thee
For ever and ever.

O Lord our Creator
Fountain of Salvation
di	Make us worthy O Lord
In Thy heavenly home
At the end of our lives
In this world of misery
That we may have a place
In Thy Kingdom, O Lord

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.4.
For all things come of Thee, and of Thine own have we given Thee. 1 Cor. 29:14

O Lord of heaven and earth and sea,
To Thee all praise and glory be;
How shall we show our love to Thee,
Giver of all.

The golden sunshine, vernal air,
Sweet flow'rs and fruits, Thy love declare
Where harvests ripen, Thou art there,
Giver of all.

For peaceful homes and healthful days,
For all the blessings earth displays,
We owe thee thankfulness and praise
Giver of all.

Thou didst not spare Thine only Son,
But gav'st Him for a world undone,
And freely with that Blessed One,
Thou giver all!

Thou giv'st the Holy Spirit's dow'r
But gav'st Him for a world undone,
And freely with that blessed One,
Upon us all.

For souls redeemed, for sins, forgiv'n,
For means of grace, and hopes of Heav'n
Father, what can to Thee be giv'n Who givest all?

Whatever, Lord, we lend to thee
Repaid a thousand fold will be,
The gladly will we give to Thee. Giver of all.

To Thee, from Whom we all derive
Our life, our gifts, our pow'r to give
Oh, may we ever with Thee live,
Giver of all.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.8.6.8.8.6.
God is love. I Joh. 4:8

Come, let us all unite and sing-
God is love!
While heaven and earth their praise bring
God is love!
Let every soul from sin awake,
Each in his sing for Jesus sake-
God is love!

O tell o earth's remotest bound-
God is love!
In Christ is full redemption found-
God is love!
His blood can cleanse our sins away;
His Spirit turns our night to day,
God is love!

How happy is our portion here-
God is love!
His promises our spirit cheer-
God is love!
He is our Sun and Shield by day,
By night He near our tents will stay,
He will be with us all the way-
God is love!

In Zion we shall sing again-
God is love!
Yet, this shall be our highest strain-
God is love!
Whilst endless ages roll along,
In concert with the heav'nly throng
This shall be still our sweetest song-
God is love!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.11.8.
And my sprit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour. Luk. 1:47

O Thou in whose presence my soul takes delight,
On whom in affliction I call,
My comfort by day and my song in the night,
My hope, my salvation, my all!

Where dost thou, dear Shepherd, resort with thy sheep,
To feed them in pastures of love;
Say, why in the valley of death should I weep,
Or alone in this wilderness rove?

He looks! And the thousands of angels rejoice,
And myriads wait for His word,
He speaks! and eternity filled wit His voice
Re echoes the praise for the Lord.

Dear Shepherd! I hear, and will follow Thy call;
I know the sweet sound of Thy voice,
Restore and defend me, for Thou art my all,
And in Thee I will never rejoice.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 8.8.6. &. Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.6. &. Ref.
But I trusted in Thee, O Lord, I said Thou art my God. Ps. 31:14.

Lord, my trust I repose on Thee
Oh, how great is Thy love to me!
Thou the strength of my life shall be;
This I know! This, I know!
Thine, Thine! and only Thine,
Now and ever Thine!
Thou dost love me, Saviour mine!
This I know, this I know.

I shall rise to a world of light,
I shall rest in a mansion bright;
Then my faith shall be lost in sight
This I know! This, I know!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.8.7.
The Lord is my Shepherd. Ps. 23:1

The King of love my Shepherd
Whose goodness faileth never;
I nothing lack if I am His
And He is mine for ever,

Where streams of living water flow
My ransomed soul He leadeth,
And where the verdant pastures grow
With food celestial feedeth

Perverse and foolish oft I strayed,
But yet in love He sought me,
di	And on His shoulder gently laid,
And home rejoicing brought me.

In death's dark vale I fear no ill
With Thee, dear Lord, beside me;
Thy rod and staff my comfort still,
Thy Cross before to guide me.

And so through all the length of days
Thy goodness faileth never;
Good Shepherd, may I sing Thy praise
Within Thy house for ever!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 6.9.8.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.9.8.&.Ref.
But He knoweth the way that to take. Job. 28:10

I have a friend who is ever nigh
Whether I sleep or wake,
Ever He guards with a watchful eye,
He knoweth the way that I take,
And keeps me when asleep or awake;
And lead me of His own name's sake,
He knoweth me way that I take.

I have a friend who is always near
One who will ne'er forsake;
What though my pathway be dark and drear,
He knoweth the way that I take.

I have a friend who will guide me on
Until the shadows break,
Leading me on, till my crown is won,
He knoweth the way that I take.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 6.76.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
6.76.&.Ref.
Rejoice the soul of thy servant for unto Thee, O Lord do I lift up my soul. Ps. 86:4

My happy, heart is singing
My heav'nly Father's love;
Se send so many blessings
Like sunbeams form above,
But Jesus is the best of all
Yes Jesus is the best of all
Of all the joys that may surround me,
The best of all is Jesus.

pf	Tho' other joy may fail me,
And sorrows may befall,
My Saviour will be with me
And He is best of all.

O, let me tell to others
The story of His, grace,
Rejoicing in His service
Until I see His face,

And when I view the glories
Within the jasper wall,
I'll sing with all the ransomed,
My Saviour's best of all.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: We love Thee, Lord, yet not alone,
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
We love Thee, Lord, yet not alone,
because Thy bounteous hand
Showers down its rich and ceaseless gifts
On ocean and on land;
We praise Thee, gracious Lord, for these,
Yet not for these alone
The incense of Thy children's love
Arises to Thy throne.

We love Thee, Lord because when
We had err'd and gone astray,
Thou didst recall our wandering
Souls into the heaven ward ways
When helpless, hopeless, we were
Lost in sin an sorrow's night
A guiding ray was granted us
From Thy pure fount of light.

Because, O Lord, Thou lovedst us
With everlasting love,
And sentest forth Thy son to die
Because, when we were heirs of wrath,
Thou gavest hopes of heaven,
Thu gavest hopes of heaven,
We love because we much have sinn'd,
And much have been forgiven.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 7.7.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.D.
Therefore brethren we are debtors. Rom. 8:12

When this passing world is done,
When has sunk yon glaring sun,
When we stand with Christ on high,
Looking o'er life's history,
Then, Lord shall I fully know-
di	Not till then,-how much I love,

When I stand before the throne,
Dress'd in beauty not my own,
When I see Thee as Thou art,
Love Thee with unsinning heart;
Then, Lord I shall I fully know,-
di	Not till then,-how much I owe,

When the praise of heav'n I hear,
Loud as thunders to the ear,
Lour as many water's noise,
Sweet as harp's melodious voice;
Then, Lord, shall I fully know,
di	Not till then,-how much I owe,

Chosen not for good in me,
Waken'd up from wrath to flee,
Hidden in the Saviour's side,
By the Spirit s sanctified,
Teach me, Lord, on earth to show,
By my love, how much I owe.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
7.7.7.
Lowest thou me. Joh. 21:16

Can a woman's tender care
Cease toward the child she bare?
di	Yes, she may forgetful be;
yet, will I remember thee.

Mine is an unchanging love,
Higher than the heights above,
Deeper that the depths beneath,
Free and faithful, strong as death

Thou shalt see My glory soon,
When the work of grace is gone,
Partner of My throne shalt be;
Say, poor sinner, lov'st thou Me?

Lord, it is my chief complaint
That my love is weak and faint,
Yet I love Thee, and adore,
O for grace to love Thee more!

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 8.8.D.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.8.D.
Continue ye in my love. Joh. 15:9

Jesus, my Lord, my God, my All,
Hear me, blest Saviour, when I call,
Hear me, and from Thy dwelling place
Pour down the riches of thy grace;
Jesus, my Lord, I Thee adore,
Oh make me love Thee more and more.

Jesus, too late I Thee have sought,
How can I love Thee as I ought?
And how extol Thy matches fame,
Th glorious beauty of Thy name?

Jesus what didst Thou find in me,
That Thou hast dealt so lovingly?
How great the joy that Thou has brought
So far exceeding hope or thought!

Jesus, of Thee shall be my song,
To Thee my heart and soul belong;
All that I have or am is Thine,
And Thou blest Saviour, Thou art

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

title: 4.6.4.&.Ref.
author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
4.6.4.&.Ref.
Leave me not, neither forsake me O God, of my salvation. Ps. 27:9

Need Thee every hour,
Most gracious Lord;
No tender voice like Thine
Can peace afford
I need Thee O I need Thee,
Every hour I need Thee
O bless me now, my Saviour,
I come to Thee

I need Thee every hour,
Stay Thou near by;
Temptations lose their power
When Thou art nigh

I need Thee every hour,
In joy or pain,
Come quickly and abide,
Or life is vain,

I need Thee every hour,
Teach me Thy will,
And Thy rich promises
In me fulfil

I need Thee every hour,
Most Holy One;
O make me Thine indeed,
Thou blessed Son.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book

author: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) Worldwide
verses:
8.7.8.7.7.7.8.
The Lord is my Shepherd. Ps. 23:1

Like a shepherd, tender, true,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,
Daily find us pastures new,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,
If thick mists are o'er the way
Or the flock 'mid danger feeds,
He will watch them lest they stray;
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,

All along life rugged road,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,
Till we reach you blest abode,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,
All the way, before He's trod,
Safe into the folds of God,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,

Through the sunlight ways of life
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,
Through the warnings and the strife,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,
When we reach the Jordan's tide,
Where life's boundary line recedes,
He will spread the waves aside,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads.

metadata.source: Christ Apostolic Church Gospel Hymn Book
